Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oVYwH7xIToeH0LrFfl9ulQ.text: Wow. As a local who's has lived here over 21 years, why have I missed this place. A hidden gem at the Tropicana. Really great comfort food, ie. shepherds pie, liver and onions, bangers n mash, etc. etc. The best Irish Coffee I have ever had.......The Bread Pudding is off the charts.The four of us spent a lot of $$$$ but it was worth every penny. The service was over the top.......really great. It is a sports, English Pub, environment.....so it can be a bit noisy. Just talk loudly and after a few minutes, you will fit right in.

WHSW5Q61ll0CucNJGZg8GA.text: I wish I could rate this place higher, since my husband had such a fantastic experience here a few months ago and has been talking it up ever since. But, this is Vegas, and competition is tough. In another city, I might have given 3 stars, but the opportunity cost on a short weekend trip is high, and this is a meal that we could have eaten elsewhere.   High points: The beer selection is impressive, and this is a great place to grab a drink on a hot day (which we did). The service was also excellent.   Low points: The food was, unfortunately, not memorable. We got the macaroni and cheese and the peach/burratta salad. The macaroni was a bit too al dente and salty for me and the peaches in the salad were not ripe. Maybe we ordered the wrong things, but I was not impressed.  I was also sad that they took the french onion fondue off the menu for the summer. Many reviews mentioned it, and again, my husband has been talking it up for months!

oqthnstP-15E_Bc8VPByog.text: 3.5 stars... New joint popped up in my radar, and mixed reviews gave me mixed emotions. I've seen the guys shows and he seems to always manage quality as a top priority. Started with the wedge salad. Cool crisp iceberg in a light vinaigrette covered with bacon and tomatoes, sitting in a lagoon of blue cheese dressing. I would have left the vinaigrette dressing off solely for calories consciousness..I didn't think it needed it. Next up was the fish and chips, and at $28 it had big expectations to satisfy. Flaky fish in a perfectly crunchy battered crust sitting atop crispy fries easiness with somewhat melty feta and a curry inspired mayo. It all worked really well together, but I will agree the price tag was a bit ego inflated. Also couldn't pass on the Mac & cheese...gooey melty goodness with all the right textures and flavors. My only complaint was the texture of the bacon was hard and did not match well with the panko as it kept getting caught in my teeth and took away from the crunch. Rounded out the meal with a server recommended(Thanks Michael!) skillet cookie. A larger scoop of ice cream is the only suggestion for this one as I ran out before the cookie was depleted.   Ambiance is upscale barrel house, prices are higher than expected, and staff was prompt, knowledgeable, and friendly!  I rarely add a restaurant to the list on first visit but this one fits the bill. This joint makes the list!

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; chips($$$ but good)Mac &amp; cheese(must try)
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wedge

Xz05rsqOGTk0-wAeOWkRMQ.text: Came here after a long day of walking the Strip. The incentive for visiting was a free appetizer, and we love free soooo.   We were seated immediately, which is always a plus. The food itself was ok - nothing out of the ordinary. I did like the modern decor and the location near the entrance to the casino/lobby is ideal. The service was good, not excellent, but good. I don't feel like the food justifies the high price point, though. You can find better elsewhere, for less.

61fBkHOz_ReX4eCbaXLbEw.text: I went here when I was at VN world in Las Vegas in August 2018. I was intrigued by the idea of many English beers and was very disappointed to find that they have the typical craft selection that every chain restaurant has. The food was underwhelming considering it's coming from a celebrity chef and the prices were what you would expect for Vegas and a well-known name. Not a great experience and I would rather go off the strip to get a decent drink then pay for a name.

Bs_JlJ3h5J0RbGNH1VpSdg.text: Staying at the Tropicana, this was an easy choice before going out for the night. Very disappointed in the food quality. I ordered a pizza and my colleague ordered a burger.  Pizza was greasy and I didn't finish it. The burger was covered in cheese....not sure why. Regardless, I wouldn't go back if I choose to stay at the hotel again.  Not one seat available at the bar, sat at a table. The restaurant reminded me of a time warp back to the seventies. The service was ok, it took longer to get a beer than to get the food.

IzEpQUhqNsud3gb-wXBGNg.text: Pretty much what I expected, but really not!  For a celebrity Chef that I have never thought had any reason to be a celebrity Chef I will say this was spot on!  I had a beer and the fish and chips. Now the beer selection was very ordinary, nothing special. The fish and chips, for a British guy he should be absolutely ashamed!  The breading was flat and bland, greasy and very blah. The fish itself was very good, I will give them that. The fries, very very average. The curry sauces was bland, with feta???  Not a combination you would pick but I was good, love feta    As the average continued I had a Manhattan which was made with a cherry from a jar, same shit you'd buy at Target...you're a celebrity chef and this is what you offer???  He should be ashamed, but it's Robert Irvine...like making that clown guy that sells burgers a celebrity chef!  Oh no, food network may do that!  KT

-tp3EtJCJgOxuhEoAzBgWA.text: I came here looking for the tomahawk steak but I guess it wasn't doing very well because it is no longer on the menu. I ordered the steak frites and was extremely disappointed. I asked for medium rare and received my tiny piece of steak well done and BURNED (NOT CHARRED). It also came with very sad small shriveled asparagus. The kitchen was already closed and I felt bad sending it back. The bartender asked how it was and I told him it was burned and over cooked. He requested that the kitchen send me a new a new piece of meat. I would NOT recommend this place. I was very sad, heartbroken and disappointed

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pG8XcU5S4z2m8WIm5UOuLg.text: This review is for the bar only.  Hubs and I went to see the Murray Show and we stop by here for Happy Hour. The World Series was on but we scored an amazing spot next to the server station walk up.   The guys behind the bar were SUPER nice and accommodating!   I ordered hubs a specialty cocktail and he loved it, can't remember what it was... but I just ordered a Stella on draft. Yes it was served in a cold Stella glass (my favorite!).  We didn't order any food but I saw that a few things that could be altered to vegan. But don't hold me to that!  I guess to sum it up is the service is A+ here. The guys love their jobs here... all and all it was a great vibe!  I highly doubt we will ever eat dinner here, but we will be back to the bar! Cheers!

SRSjw-pYP_QfzKaLMeRliA.text: Its located in the Tropicana casino. It has a lot of tv's, a horseshoe shaped bar and dining area. Its touted for their food and variety of beers.  Came in to watch a football game. The servers and hostesses were very friendly. Pal asked for three beers on tap and bottle, but they were out of  them. Other people were apologized too, for not having their beer choice on tap available. It was explained about certain kegs not moving and the menu needed updating. Well, if you're touting youself as having a variety of beer, someone had better get things refilled or updated. I sound frustrated only because I expected more from a celebrity person headed restaurant. Someone is not doing their job.  Also, Margherita pizza took suspiciously long to come to us, that even our bartender personally went to doublecheck our order for us. 45 minutes is unacceptable.

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 45 min pizza
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Joseph James

D2h2wCo2M_5CtPUaOEQm0A.text: Enjoyed my meal there over the weekend. I had the pastrami Rueben. Lots of good drink choices.   My wife loved the cheeseburger.

15ddTBxl0UKou30tcrtmOA.text: So my wife and I visit restaurants associated with big television personalities ever so often and we will splurge for these restaurants.  Today was a huge disappointment for my wife and for me.  Mr. Irvine the restaurant you have here is mediocre at best and not just in comparison to the other strip restaurants.  The design of the restaurant is fine, but it is extremely smoky due to the surrounding casino.  The drink selection is fine and the menu choices are what I would expect from a British born chef.  Here is where it starts to go awry.  My wife ordered a chicken dish and when we got it the chicken was bland and the gravy was lukewarm at best.  The potatoes were completely unmemorable even though they took up half of the plate.  I honestly believe the chicken at the excalibur show across the street had more flavor.  The best part of this almost 30 dollar dish was the cauliflower.  Now on to the dish which the waitress described as their signature dish, the fish and chips.  I was expecting crispy tasty breading with flavor and what I received was tasteless and rather soggy.  The French fries were okay, but covered in some kind of weird liquidy mayo concoction.  The bacon even lacked flavor.  My recommendation is as follows.  Dont waste your money on Irvine's place as it really is not worth the money.  There are far better celebrity options like Giada and Mesa grill.  These are slightly more pricey, but well worth the extra coin.  Overall a disappointment and my perception of Robert Irvine as a chef is forever changed.

1DKeW1WESU8vkKBK_Brpjw.text: Has a friend staying at the Tropicana for Memorial weekend and so we decided to meet there and have some dinner/drinks.    This is a fairly new place and has a great atmosphere.   They offer a huge dining area and a bar with a lot of tvs for sports.    We sat in the dining area and had great service and good food.  They offer a good selection of beer and wine too.    For dinner we had the Kale salad, some pizza and a few different beers.    I'll be back and I recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7OPUsfyPQt1LmgtuHXw3eg.text: Very underwhelmed about this place.  Especially from a food celebrity expectation. Just saying.   The restaurant is Block by slot machines so it is difficult to find.   my friends decided on this place due to seeing a show in the Tropicana. Agreed to meet up for dinner.  Service - 5 stars it was spot on. The waitress even offered to split appetizer on separate bills as their POS system has that option.  Ambiance - the interior and design felt old and tired much like the casino. It felt as though they kept the old interior decor from a previous restaurant in the interest of saving money. not what I expected from a food network celebrity.   Food - croquettes were good. Not sure I would of used tzatziki sauce with croquettes? But ok.   I ordered the shepherds pie. Portion was good. Serviced in a cast iron dish. Food piping hot like it should be. HOWEVER it had so much oil in it I think I might of had a heart attack. Please see my photo for reference. no dish in a restaurant should have a pool of oil sitting in the bottom of it. The pie could of used some more veggies in it too. I've had better.   Yes I could of sent it back - however -  One of my gripes with Vegas restaurants . Many people have a show to attend after dinner. Sending it back to wait for it to be redone properly simply isn't an option due to time constraints.   I tried a bite of my friends fried liver and onions. the liver was tender and flavorful. Crust was a complement and didn't over power the liver.   My friends salmon looked spectacular as far as presentation. I didn't get a chance to try it.   I do recommend their fingerling potatoes. Buttery and creamy on the inside - not dry which I loved.   Walking out I saw a couple of dishes on other tables that looked way more wow than the ones we ordered. Yes I love to stalk other people's plates in restaurants don't judge me .   I feel like this restaurant could of been a crown and facelift to the tired Tropicana - but it managed to blend into the mediocre casino and didn't do anything to impress me.  If you are looking for an amazing pub experience I recommend Gordon Ramsey's pub restaurant inside the caesars palace. it will knock your socks off.

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Liver and onions
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shepherds pie

HxZ-C1WiXibsT1lowukJJg.text: I've watched Robert Irvine on Restaurant Impossible for years and the biggest complaint he has for chefs he works with is that they do not season their food enough.  I think it must have been a long time since Robert has eaten at this location as that was the main complaint from everyone at our table as well - no/not enough seasoning on any of the dishes.  Walking in the atmosphere was very nice.  Pub feel with dark wood, but lots of windows so it did not feel dreary.  We were quite excited to eat/drink here.  The bartender was really nice and let us sample several of the many beers on the menu.  After selecting the ones we liked best we turned to food.  Our table ordered the F&K Fondue burger (you pour the cheese over it)/fries, a Pastrami Rachael sandwich/fries, the potato/chicken soup and a Pepperoni pizza. The best comment from our group was 'the beer is good'.  The F&K Fondue burger was too messy to eat with the cheese, so they just had the burger which was just OK.  The Pastrami Rachael sandwich was good, but one side of the bread was totally soggy.  Everyone at the table felt that the fries had no seasoning at all - not even salt.  Most of them were left on the plates.  I was surprised that the potato/ chicken soup did not have chunks of potato or chicken in it.  I could taste the potato, which was the consistency of mashed potatoes, and found only the smallest of pieces of chicken - nothing like I expected.  The pepperoni pizza was good (not great), but kind of hard to mess that up. :)  All in all it was a very disappointing experience.  I really love Robert but I don't think he knows what the food at his restaurant comes out tasting (or not tasting) like.

cIOzb4KiaTL8GI9Ts4X7nQ.text: We had a great experience. As we walked in, Robert came over, chatted with us, set a great mood for the evening. Our waiter, Casey, was amazing. Little details like - he saw the we ordered a wedge salad and wings - I heard me say that I thought it was a nice match because of the blue cheese dressing. Wings do not come with blue cheese, but he brought it out (even though I didn't ask). Coming back again when in Vegas.

If this place is going to stay in business needs to work on quality of each dish they send out. Meh save ur 26 bucks and go some were else on the strip and get a mediocre steak and a beer. Maybe the chef that is expediting should be off his phone and worry about quality of his food he sends out.         $26 for pie go have a burger and a beer instead on the strip instead of the Guinness steak and pie.            Get two stars because are server was nice an polite even though I sent my food back

JreispA9GcAkWoMz66R05A.text: Where to start! From the ambiance to the food, amazing experience! Absolutely loved the decore inside, everything was so welcoming, the staff was awesome! Our server was great help when it came to deciding on drinks   Now the food!!! I had a medley of food to eat. Started off with the keep calm and Cary on, signature drink, and it was amazing! They had a great choice of mixed drinks and an even bigger choice of draft and bottled beers. For appetizers i had the French onion fondue and the lump crab arancini  Oh My Gosh! For the first time have a fondu I hope every other time is as good as this one, the onion the cheese it was purely amazing and delicious. Now the lump crab arancini, heaven sent crab balls!!!!!! Lol, they were sooooooo goood I could I've eaten those and only those, the crab so tender lightly breaded with hints of lemon in the meat! Along with the sauce in the plate became an instant fave! I then went on to have the roasted vegetable salad, absolutely a great salad, I have to be completely honest here and say it wasn't one of my favorite dishes solely because the salad comes with cilantro, and I'm not a huge fan of cilantro, kinda took away from the salad for me, but cilantro aside the rest of the salad along with the tahini dressing was very good! For my entree I had the ponzu glazed grilled salmon, by far the best salmon I've had at a restaurant in a while, the sauce it came with was absolutely amazing and the ponzu flavor was not too salty and just enough hint of lemon, along with the spinach the dish was exquisite  Last and not least desert! I tried the bread pudding which was very delectable! The sauce was delightful and the almond brittle was great!  In all my experience was wonderful and will definitely be returning! Highly recommended for a casual dining experience

Had to wave him down to get a dessert menu, our coffee and tea was brought with no milk or spoons, bus boy went to get milk after we told him and then had to go back again to get spoons. We were encouraged to try it by the front desk when we checked in & they have us two coupons. If we wanted to use one we had to order 1 entire which I did not really want to begin with. S5CgVxKuWSwxQVDAnd5JCw.text: What a wonderful experience!  Our server was George.  He earns 5 stars just for himself!   I ordered a Moscow Mule.  He brought me a blueberry one to try and said if I didn't like it, they would gladly remake me a standard one.  It was delicious with a spear of blueberries for garnish and muddled blueberries on the bottom. My husband and daughter had very good Bloody Marys.  My daughter and I split the fish and chips and the pork schnitzel.  Both were delicious.  My husband got a pastrami sandwich which was huge.  My grandson got the tasty burger.   Today is our anniversary.  George brought us out a platter decorated in chocolate and a tribute written on it.  I wish I can remember the name of the dessert, but it came with a scoop of creamy ice cream. Thank you for honoring military by offering a discount which we didn't know until we were done eating. Cheers to Robert Irvine for highly honoring our military.

Y24nhGZJe-LV3D-0KfrOFQ.text: I stopped here and ate yesterday before going to The Laugh Factory at Tropicana. I had fish and chips. The fish itself was nice and flaky. The breading however was too sweet for the savory fish. It wasn't bad, but I ended up eating the fish and the breading separately. The chips were a nice surprise. The server was a conscientious enough to mention they come with green onions, bacon, and cheese. Good flavor, if not a bit salty. This is the kind of place you go to for food that soaks up some alcohol! I don't think I'd seek this place out specifically unless I happened to be in Tropicana for something else and didn't want "food court" food.

eQGCPMEdVHAjqEK96o-vbg.text: Quickly seated and staff were excellent. The main reason for the fewer stars is the pricing.  I expect pricing to be higher in Vegas.  I was here for a couple of weeks for work.  Of all of the places I ate, the pricing here bothered me the most.  I had the fish and chips.  As a elite member my appetizer was free.  The fish was average, not bad, but nothing extraordinary.  Fries were prepared sort-of poutine-like (covered in cheese, etc..).  So to sum it up, I had the fish and chips, free appetizer, and water.  $39 after tip and tax.      Thank heaven I did not order a desert.  I would have had to take out a loan.

_R5MpwI816L39UZxDwxbEw.text: This is a good place and deserves 3.5-4; not a 5. Really good service, $10 overpriced overall. The food was quality; nothing really unique.  Irvine should visit a couple of gastropubs in Ca to get an idea on improving this to a 5. One is in Lodi and the other is in Capitola.

Service is very slow. Being seated and getting water is fine...it's the waitress.  She's friendly and attentive when she's at your table...but it's getting her TO you table that is the challenge.

Uv4uUVqs_rNAIGDKGAg1OQ.text: Not great for the price. Atmosphere is great but food so-so for the cost. Better off stopping in for drinks only - after vgk games.   I went back for drinks. Really good for that.

mJqEDztOeJIhrCOBSPtJZg.text: My wife and I visited Robert Irvine's Public House last night for my birthday. It did not disappoint. We were promptly greeted with personalized service by our hostess who wished me a happy birthday on the spot (Details included on the reservation, very attentive!) and also confirmed our desire for a booth location.  My wife took her seat and I made a quick detour to the restroom before having my seat. The restroom was very clean, by the way.  when I made my return to the table we already had mineral water and lemons on our table. Mind you, we usually have to wait a few extra minutes for lemons but they were certainly on top of it. Our server, Ruben, was outstanding as well. There may be an edit coming later if that isn't his name, I don't have my receipt in front of me.  He was knowledgeable about the beer selection and offered up the soup of the day option without being prompted. Once we ordered, he also kept us constantly informed of the status of our meals until it was delivered. They were busy but it never felt like we were forgotten, which is a strong attribute to their guest service quality.  The beer of the night for me was an Able Baker Chris Kael Impale'd Ale, a local brew with a 10% alcohol level. It was as smooth as can be. A little buzz to start the evening is always a good thing. The beer selection at Public House is impressive but not overwhelming which makes it easier to come to a quick decision on a drink, as opposed to mulling through 3 to 4 pages consisting of hundreds of selections. Not that I don't enjoy a large beer selection at times, but the main event here is the food -- the beer and drink selection should complement the food menu at a restaurant of this variety, not vice versa. Chef Irvine understands and I'm appreciative.  We ordered the chicken fingers and a side of garlic truffle fries for our meal. Again, we share everything. The chicken was seasoned well and cooked thoroughly and I LOVED the garlic truffle fries. They were a nice thickness and not overly saturated with grease. The dip that came with the fingers, a sriracha buttermilk ranch and traditional buffalo sauces were a nice touch. They made great dipping fodder for the fries as well.  We were too full to order dessert, so I can't speak on it for this particular review but we intend on making another trip here in the future. They have definitely earned it!  Bonus: The Tropicana provides FREE parking for their guests as well. That's always a beautiful thing!

4sAdu9VtZxsQpPiJ8TricQ.text: I have been a big fan of Robert Irvine and was very excited to go to his restaurant.  Servers were quite friendly and attentive.  Menu had a nice variety.  Only reason I gave 4 stats out of 5 was that it was extremely noisy to the point I couldn't even hear the guests with me.  It was Cowboy Christmas weekend so it was quite crowded.  But I will definitely go back next tome in Vegas.

ttQG-kAINCwD9UYtALxuDg.text: The food was good, not great but what impressed me was the service.   The french onion fondue was more like a cream sauce that you dip bread in instead of a cheesy fondue. The duck confit was good especially with the sriracha butter sauce. The salmon was good but overcooked to our liking. If you like it medium like I do, make sure to ask for it. The pizza was actually the best thing we had. It's all made from scratch.  The duck confit actually came out under cooked the first time. Our server Fred was on it and took care of us. He took it off our bill and ordered a new dish for me. Chef Shawn brought it out to our table and apologized for the last dish and even offered my dining partner something so she won't have to just watch me eat since she already finished her dish. I am truly impressed how genuinely concerned they were about their mistake and made up for it. We felt taken care of and that's really all I ask for as a customer.

px_evmjvHLWanqvXLQbImg.text: On 9/14/18 we decided to eat at The  Public House, which is owned by Robert Irvine. Our visit did not disappoint on any level!  The food, service, bartenders, Rob the manager and Robert have it together! It was great to meet Robert in person and we were able to have our picture taken with him as well.  He is warm, open,and makes you feel right at home.  Stop in and you'll see what I am talking about.  Thank you  Robert for a wonderful experience, keep doing what your doing!   Best Regards, Penny & Jim Willimont  Boynton Beach, Fl.

POuXGdpOvxSm-ShRyTtFsg.text: This place is the great. 100 beers. Great, great staff. All super attentive. I had the poke appetizer. It was spicy, yet cool. It was great. I also had the margarita pizza. It was pretty good. Poke was better. Great place to meet people and have a few before doing crazy stuff in Vegas.

8DFHGmrIRs_WM8Aw3Ejk7w.text: Happy to wander the world seeking out great meals but not so fond of Food Television there was no real reason to know Robert Irvine before the Chef opened up shop at The Tropicana, and although the name Public House still seems terribly unoriginal with two additional Restaurants similarly dubbed less than 3/4 mile away it looks as though the Restaurant Impossible star's spot is doing quite well based on a visit Saturday evening  Reportedly built at the request of Tropicana High Rollers in need of a place to use comps, the property certainly never considered a dining destination in a city filled with several Resorts that could legitimately make such a claim, Robert Irvine's Public House officially opened its doors in July after significant hype including a daredevil stunt during which the TV-Star lept from the top of the white tower over a year prior, Chef Scott Green making his return to Las Vegas after a stint in Canada to head up a kitchen focused on accessible fare and Irvine's British upbringing  Admittedly a first-timer at The Tropicana, its southerly location on The Strip and lack of dining venues never really a draw despite being one of the few places in town still offering free parking, it is upon entering the front doors that signs immediately point guests left towards the sprawling room with a bar and lounge up front plus several tables and banquets lining the space behind, a dinner rush of over 150 covers seeing the place slammed on a big football weekend but a party of four happy to wait until the assigned 8pm reservation time while sitting at a 1st come-1stserve high top.  Doing a reasonable job of isolating itself from the floor, a walkway between slot machines and Public House's doors at least 15 feet wide, it is only once diners make their way to the back that the full scope of design can be seen, varying shades of wood comprising floor and ceilings sandwiching comfortable orange leather seats, stone walls and a big glass window facing Las Vegas Boulevard outside.  Dining with three frequent tablemates and thus able to sample a wide range of the menu it was after others had requested Cocktails and Beers featuring flavors like Peanut Butter and Passion Fruit that Food was ordered, a total of 12 savories far more than would be recommended for even a group of six and beginning with Appetizers including Deviled Eggs atop Mustard alongside Tater Tot "Poutine" with Pulled Pork and Goat Cheese plus smoky Wings featuring Irvine's own Buffalo Sauce and 2 styles of housemade Dressing.  By no means a bad way to begin, even those tired of "small plates" and "gastropubs" likely to find lots to love in the Tots that remain crispy beneath Mushroom Gravy and a bubbling dish of French Onion Fondue meant to be slathered on Toast, it was with some additional Bread requested and Gruyere still molten that a trio of Salads soon appeared, the Heirloom Tomatoes vibrant and acidic amidst fresh Herbs and Garlic while the ubiquitous Beet Salad outperformed many thanks to Grapes and lightly pickled flavors, the same sadly not to be said for a dish simply listed as "Roasted Vegetables" that featured good Produce but seemed poorly conceived as the Sauce was too thick to be considered 'Soup' and too runny to function as Dip without getting messy.  Using a pair of bar items plus thick-cut Steak Tartare served with housemade Potato Chips as a sort of mid-course, crowds beginning to dwindle around 9:30, suffice it to say that the much publicized F&K Burger smothered in Cheese is tasty but plenty in its smaller "Slider" format while the shrunk-down Fish & Chips unfortunately suffered from Cod being too bland, the bed of matchstick Fries showing far better amidst Bacon, Feta and thickened Vinegar.  Rounding out savories with two items one won't just find anywhere in Sin City, the Buttermilk fried Duck Confit crisp and intensely flavored but balanced by a Jean Georges-esque combination of braised Greens plus "buttery" Hot Sauce and Irvine's signature "Stone Fired Shepherd's Pie" achieving where many others fail by letting the Potatoes get a little bit crispy which adds texture to the classic Lamb filling, it was with most already stuffed that four Desserts arrived with each presentation proving at least enough to warrant a bite from each...and several more for others.  Part classic and part clever, items like Apple Pie and Blue Cheesecake saved for a later date, it was instead with bites of Robert's famous Banoffee Pie that things got underway and taking a far lighter approach than most to the combination of Bananas and Toffee while mellowing sweetness with Espresso Ice Cream the presentation sets a high bar for the dish locally, the same to be said of traditional Spotted Dick served in warm Vanilla Sauce while the Dark Chocolate Skillet Cookie and "Dessert Shepherd's Pie" are definitely best shared, the former as rich as it sounds while the item in cast iron riffs on Trifle with sliced Berries, Meringue and cubes of Pound Cake

FzQHQRwjU92KJp_X-7KXhg.text: Waiter said soup of day was potato. We got cream of spinach with chicken. Was good but definitely not potato soup. Where's the cheese and bacon. Why does my soup have green things floating in it. Also, took half an hour for not potato soup. Had the steak frites. Was ok. A bit salty and some fatty pieces. Wife got half chicken. How do you screw up chicken. Why cover crispy skin with gravy? Mashed potatoes were definitely instant from a box. A disappointing meal. We had high hopes.

76QOCRaOjUFRPg5dTKzJWg.text: Rip off! Paid 28 bucks for one card deck size of fish for the fish and chips! This was one of the only open restaurants at Tropicana Hotel. Everything was expensive with super small portions. I don't think they will make it pass 2 years, but then again, they are the only place open late (close at 11 pm)so customers by default. UPDATE: went this am to ask if standard size of fish and chips was what I got, was told no and manager JP, comped me a meal. That's good customer service. Low stars because at the price I am paying, I shouldn't have had to complain.

lgqEWHWUeVGttUS-ttEOAw.text: Super pleased!   Food was delicious!  Excellent service.  The space was casual, modern and inviting.  I will be back!

871olL0i2hJbar3hw42Sjw.text: My husband and I had the pleasure of dining here last night. Wonderful atmosphere, and the food is fresh and delicious. We also were happy to meet Mr Robert Irvine himself while dining! It was a delightful experience. He is down to earth welcoming and well... yeah he's a handsome guy!  I highly recommend to anyone especially if you are staying at the Tropicana !!

rXvwQOLER0qjXogR57RiJg.text: I am not sure how this place rates higher than 1 star from anyone. The food is LOUSY and with so many choices this is a place you can afford to skip. The menu is about as basic as it gets but they still manage to just miss the mark across the board. The manager comped our meal, it wasn't necessary as it wasn't what we were looking for, we just wanted dinner. I had the chicken sandwich, my friend had the Fish and chips, to sum it up, YUCK! Fish was gummy and the chicken sandwich was sawdust. Ordered a Wedge Salad but after 20 minutes the waiter came to our table and said they were out of iceberg lettuce, it was too late to pivot and make another choice. He offered . side salad which was fine but by the time it got to the table the entree' had been there for 5+ minutes so who wants it at that point. Like I said, there are 1000's of places to eat in Vegas on and off the strip, go to one of the other choices, you aren't going to get much worse than this if you make a bad choice.

cN5FzvNlkt4bQXqJ3kBheA.text: Great service and good food. Steak and Frites was delicious. They have a very large beer and wine selection but the food menu is on the smaller side. Not a lot of Gluten-Free options but I made do.

SAasgzKXOubh65Ml7-63MA.text: Went to the bar at about 2 pm. Sat there for 10 minutes as 3 or 4 people looked at me behind the bar while they were cleaning. I was never acknowledged or even engaged in conversation in conversation. I was able to study the best menu quite extensively during my 10 to 15 minutes of sitting there with Out being greeted. I tried to start conversation with the staff. They said Robert Irvine has been there before but really doesn't care about the restaurant. Wish I could have written a different review. If only I had asked to place my order.

EH-FTZq2z9iAMMg8tCAPtg.text: I like Robert Irvine show restaurant impossible. So i was excited to see his restaurant in Tropicana casino. I had the burger with ham and egg it was cold burger egg and ham the fries were semi warm not hot. The roasted vegetables were not roasted. But the service was fair. Probably never go back.

guVf3ms4g8LwICOf34w3bw.text: Their lunch menu is uninspiring, prices a little high and the food was so so. We won't be back to many other options that are much better.

lMwHT3Vflbev6iS42x9XkQ.text: Skip this place. There are SO many other places to eat in Vegas that are actually good. The chicken burger was DRY and so was the bun it came on. We had a party of seven in our group and no one was happy with the food. One person sent their meal back. Way overpriced. Terribly disappointing.

bCyzQNgv0wSEj2q5SkSn0Q.text: Very loud, but that is to be expected. The service was good and the food was above average. We had five people at our table, all with different entrees, and we had no complaints. I would return if there wasn't such an abundance of great places on the strip.

Gnsy_MxWONJ5q6zlH1sGAA.text: Excellent atmosphere and food.    Had the pleasure of meeting Chef Irvine when I visited on their 1 year anniversary.

pzuuDlixB0VXp0Oq8YVNyw.text: HORRIBLE service!  Big fan of Robert Irvine's TV shows, so I was looking forward to actually trying some of his 'product' first-hand.   While my horrible experience isn't attributable to him, it left a bad enough impression, plus there are plenty of other great venues in the Las Vegas area, that I have zero desire to give his place a second try.  A friend & I showed-up at about 8:15PM last night (a Monday evening).  No line at the hostess stand, and plenty of dinner tables & seats looked open & ready inside.    The hostess informed us that they'd just cleared out a large group (VMWare convention is in-town), so that they were re-assembling the dining area, a table for us would be ready in "a couple minutes," and that we were welcome to sit at the bar while waiting for our table.    We sat at the bar, & I was happy to see they've got a very impressive selection of beers.  We each ordered one beer.  I'm a 'lightweight' when it comes to alcohol & since I had driven us to the Tropicana, alcohol consumption was a careful event for me.  But because I believed we'd be there for at least an hour and that I'd eat a large meal, I got a beer that sounded interesting, but had a high volume of alcohol in it.   The beer was great. Eventually the bartender asked if we'd like to run a tab, and I said yes, because we were waiting to be seated for dinner, & would like the two beers just added to our dinner tab.    She informed us that wasn't possible -- drinks ordered at the bar had to be paid for at the bar.  OK, a nuisance, but no big deal...  We finished our beers after about 20 minutes, and still had not been seated at a dining table.  We had to flag-down the bartender to pay for the drinks, then we got up & went to the hostess stand, about 12' away & in plain sight of where we'd sat at the bar.  By now, there was a small line of people waiting in-front of the stand, but since we'd already checked-in, we stood towards the side & patiently waited for a couple min.  The hostess made eye contact with us, and I politely mentioned to her -- the same hostess we originally dealt with about 22 min prior (the one who said our dining table would be ready in "a few minutes" & suggested we sit at the bar in the meantime) that it'd been a while, & we were still waiting for our table.  She gave us a blank look, and asked my name.   I gave it to her, and she checked what apparently was a waiting list that she was carrying, then said something like "I don't see your name on the list."   Well of-course she didn't -- she never asked for my name when we first checked-in with her.    Without an apology or any sign of guilt, she then had the audacity to add my name to the *bottom* of the list, with about 5 names above it.    Thankfully, there was a second hostess that I think must have known that the other one was incompetent, as she came over immediately afterwards & told us she'd try to seat us quickly.   But only as we were being led to a dining table were we informed by this other hostess that we could have ordered & consumed dinner while seated at the bar. and that for some reason, the only food items they were able to serve that night were burgers, pizzas, and one other type of food, *not* the full menu.  Upon hearing this, we'd experienced enough of Robert Irvine's Public House treatment, and opted to dine elsewhere.  While choosing whether or not I am sober enough to drive a car is always *my* responsibility, the sheer ineptitude we experienced at Robert Irvine's Public House caused us to leave long before we anticipated, and without consuming the food which would have sobered me up enough to get behind the wheel.    Had we just gone there for a beer, or considered that their incompetence could have resulted in us leaving The Tropicana sooner than expected, I would either have not consumed the one beer, or would have chosen a beer with less alcohol.     We ended up having to just kill time wandering around The Tropicana for about 45 minutes before I felt I was safe to drive my car.  Obviously, doing so was important, but it was also more of my valuable time wasted by the incompetent hostess at Robert Irvine's Public House, & as a result, I have zero desire to return to it, and very little interest in even returning to The Tropicana.     As a fan of his various shows, including the one where he'd help train/re-train restaurant staff & owners on customer-service, the irony of my first & likely last experience at one of his own restaurants isn't lost on me.

8Ts0fAt1MdTUzkQf07nx5Q.text: First place is nice, beers are cold and food is good but pricey and small portions.  We had a table reservation and decided to sit at the bar for drinks and apps. The bar is huge and the first thing you see. It gets back up there people waiting for tables however my main point is the bar and tenders are a mess. There were literally 6 guys and 1 lady behind the bar and people had to wait forever to get someone's attention to order a drink while they waited.  The worse thing I experienced was there were 3 chairs next to us and a party of 4 came. They went to pull a chair so they all could sit together and the bartender Chris say no you can't do that, chairs can't be moved! So the guy goes back to his party and stands.. to have dinner and drinks! Completed rude and non services based restaurant that's for sure. There wasn't adding a chair to a full bar and there was a ton of room! Bartender says we can't move chairs because it becomes an unorganized mess like a car accident WTF?!?! That the stupid shit I have ever heard you are not adding additional chairs to create a traffic jam lmao you are moving a chair down to service the paying customer who is eventually going to need to tip you and help you with your life! Worse customer service I have ever seen! But they will let some violent man sit at the bar and scare people.. what a shame we won't be returning.

-fbzcZcpF3ZGYuQ8H0TRFw.text: Thank you for responding back. We will be back in March/April.  I am hopeful that the menu will improve.  The venue itself is lovely. The bar and bartenders were terrific.

96kgGmcL3lb0eMm1r6LdEw.text: New Years Day about 1:40 pm. Was exited to try the newest celebrity chef addition to the Vegas strip.. underwhelmed. Disappointing. I actually imagines Robert Irvine screaming at the chef had he been there. Lol. Portion sizes were good. Croque Madame was good except that the fried egg on top was over cooked. Isn't that the whole point of the egg, the runny goodness? Chicken waffles were ok. Chicken was over cooked, hard to eat. Service at bar was decent. Had the option of "waiting" for a table even though the restaurant was more than 1/2 empty. Chose the bar. Good to try. Probably won't be back given all the other food choices in Vegas.

wV6OgRBBIKxlLYU8_ik1jQ.text: Beautiful place but disappointing food and service. The service was lackluster, our waiter seemed unable to handle his tables in a half empty place early on Saturday evening. Ordered the skirt steak medium rare and after long wait time it came out way over cooked. After finally flagging down our waiter he admitted it was well done and took it back. Kitchen seemed embarrassed to bring it out - had a food runner bring it out without any apologies and quickly depart. The new food service manager came by and I told her the story and she did comp me and apologized on behalf of the restaurant. Robert Irvine's high standards are surely not followed and Vegas has too many good choices to come back.

751_w4PSPAEREziXSTnySQ.text: Horrible customer service and a lack of hospitality even before arrival! We had a reservation for 3:00 pm at Robert Irvine's Public House. We were in Las Vegas for my wife's birthday weekend over Super Bowl weekend. Our uber was late in picking us up and traffic was bad as a courteous guest we called Roberts Irvine's Public House at 3:10 pm to let the hostess staff know we were enroute and 1 mile or less away. We were immediately told "well we can't guarantee your table now" in a rude,short, snotty manner. What, we didn't even HAVE to call your business at all. We were only trying to be proactive and communicate as a courtesy. I told my wife "why would we show up to possibly be told we don't have a table for you" as it was Super Bowl Sunday and this is why we had made a reservation in advance. We decided why spend a dime in this business with such poor customer service even before arrival. It's sad as 2 weeks ago I was sitting with Robert Irvine at an event in Paradise Valley, Az. I see a training opportunity here as a newer business in which hospitality and guest service has to be a key component in your business model from start to finish of each experience. We chose to spend our money elsewhere,unfortunately.

xDtZkRvtxBAK_YRJ-LnpAg.text: I am sitting in this establishment and am amazed at the lack of any care or concern for the reputation of this business. My group walked in and ask to sit at a table, hostess sat us at a table that still had waste food from what I can only assume was the last customer. All around us there were multiple tables in the same or worse condition cleanliness wise. And they all remained that way for the entire time we were there, including the table we were sitting at. Staff walking past them and us constantly ignored the mess.  Went to the bar asked for 3 of the listed 100 available beers. No you can only have one...the Guinness has not settled and the Kona is not available...so not 100...who would really know how many are truthfully available.  Made my thoughts known to the hostess, no interest whatsoever...  Place is complete rubbish, avoid it if at all possible by walking no more than 100 yards to any number of better options

KnJOJ4pPO_v9-rCUMpzRGA.text: Get the French onion fondu app, it was delicious! I had the friend chicken and kale and it was super good as well. Made me a believer in kale lol. The drink of choice for dinner was the cosmo. It was sweet taste drink but none the less I enjoyed that too. Overall had a wonderful experience!

Au97xPOA-lAI0GfSNCbRsw.text: This eatery just opened up a few months ago. We were seated immediately upon entering for dinner. It took our waitress 10 minutes to come to our table. We had a party of 4. The food was 50/50. The salmon was edible and I  really enjoyed the lamb. The fries were old and dried out and so were the chicken wings. We found a piece of hair in our ketchup. Let's just say, we were disappointed.

9DmUGoPSLXUArRQrK0oY9w.text: Been here twice. Food is OK but not stunning. The service is confused and indifferent -- lots of wait staff standing around chatting while customers get no service, and then when there is service they screw it up, get orders wrong, etc. Simply not up to Vegas standards. Also, ambiance is suspiciously like an upscale Denny's or a Hilton's breakfast room circa. 1971. Front-of-house management should be handed a copy of the classifieds and their last paycheck.

Bu7_PLP4xnj4B9TjaoXrrg.text: Here now. Worst service we've had all weekend. Cannot get anyone's attention. Had to send traditional poutine back - lukewarm. Deviled eggs were stuffed with "yolk cream" so almost impossible to pick up without crushing. Watching bartenders walk back and forth past us without stopping. Forget this place. Heading out. Expected more from Robert Irvine. Just remembered: we also had issues with this place being out of certain beers.

fzw26F4LNguyvXlcnBtXLg.text: The restaurant has only been open about a month. I had the F&K BURGER. $21 for a small burger and fries with a huge bowl of some queso type cheese on the side. It was odd. I had to send my fries back because they were inedible (cold, hard, and old).  My queso was luke warm to begin with. After I got my new order of fresh fries, cheese bowl was cold. Even then, the fries simply did not taste fresh cut and had no salt. I asked if the burger was supposed to have bacon because I didn't taste or see the bacon in it. The bartender told me it was more like bits and pieces of bacon. The burger was ok. It lacked flavor. I asked for medium rare and it was slightly more towards rare but I'm on with that. We had to eat at the bar due to a 30 min wait but there were several empty tables?  I'm sure it was due to reservations that apparently never showed. The bartenders were nice with great service. I would NOT recommend eating here. The food is not worth it. You get better food and slightly cheaper at the food court across the street in another casino.

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. F&amp;K Burger. Medium rare but a little more rare than I preferred. Cold and hard old fries. Where&#39;s the bacon it was supposed to have?
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small burger with cold fries and a bowl of some queso type cheese on the side.

LWUmBDzwOTy8kiItl4L_fA.text: I'm a fan of Robert Irvine and after seeing how strict he is on his programs I expected more. To start the hostess was friendly. We ordered our appetizer came 15 mins later our entree 30 minutes later and we ordered it with the appetizer. Then we ordered dessert. 30 minutes later I ask the waiter and he says I'll check. He's still checking because it never came. Asked for the check another 20 minutes waiting and no check. So I got up went looking for the waiter and he hands me the check and tells me to fill it out, it was a room charge, and leave it at the register. No thank for visiting. I read an article where Robert says he wants his guests to feel at home well if this is home to him and I don't want to visit again. I felt as if I were begging for my food. I'm giving 1 star because the food was good but I really wanted to try his signature dessert but I guess they went to England to get it

WG-R47VNrw1x5a_bumgOsA.text: Horrible food. We waited over an hour after ordering, even with several empty tables. It must have been sitting for awhile as it was cold. Service was poor. Had to ask for salt and pepper. Couldn't hear conversation as the piped in music was way too loud and screaming pop rock. We asked for it to be turned down, but no such thing. Would not recommend this place to anyone!

l6-WKdqsSBwFLg16gIrvZA.text: everything was good here!  came mid day, so it was fast seating, but filled up quick!  great service, and better food!  will come again!

DO5gg1g5xDe_NahUv4wxUw.text: they had changed their menu on the day we went and many of the things we had seen on line were no longer available.  Two in our party ordered the fish and chips, both came out with the fish appearing to be undercooked so they sent it back and replaced it with a burger.  The food was average and you would think a new place that served undercooked fish would be discounting something, NOPE, no discount, no round of drinks, nothing.  I understand that things happen but usually a manager does something to make it "right", he did come by our table to apologize but nothing else was done.  I would not go back, the food was average nothing spectacular.

-z9aEXqOTZ65xSU51b23bA.text: Outstanding service and food from start to finish. Despite being a busy Saturday night our server was prompt and attentive. Everything we ordered was excellent. We can't wait to return.

N1lcS5DCOlSD8JWp0SrNwg.text: Had lunch there. The lobster roll was beautifully presented but unfortunately lacked flavor. The bread was the best part of the meal. Service was good. But good is not worth the money. My husband had the fish and chips. He said portion was generous but average taste. We were disappointed.

7ojqKJ9Qa7-2IkD6mO6syA.text: Arrived on a Saturday about noon for lunch.  We were greeted and seated immediately.  We were seated at a table with a broken tabletop that wobbled like crazy.  I would've thought the staff would know the table was broken before sitting us there.  We moved to the table next to us and informed our waiter about the table.  He and another waiter carried the broken table away and then came back carrying what I thought was a new table.  It wasn't a new table cause when another couple asked to sit at that table they were told it was broken.  It was just odd all around.  The service and food were excellent despite the table ordeal.  The iceberg salad was excellent with the homemade blue cheese dressing.  The prosciutto pizza was amazing!  The fig on the pizza created a wonderful flavor profile with the backdrop of the salty prosciutto.  Looking forward to going back at dinner to try the steak or other dinner entrees.

GBZIujV0QTsWTzCaeakmCA.text: I ordered fish and chips , their Buffalo wing and their prosciutto pizza. The prosciutto pizza was amazing the wings were so-so and the fish and chips were horrible . I had to ask a few times for a refill on my ice tea mind you, I was sitting at the bar with only seven people and seven bartenders and Bar backs working . The manager came over and said he was sorry and the he would comp the fish and chips . I said that would be great !! . The check came and it still had the the fish and chips on it . The bartender asked a second manager ( I forget her name ) what to do she told him the wrong way , then the had to finger again to do it right ( the way the bartender said to do it when he talked to her ) this is going on for 10 to 15 mins . She comes to me and start trying to tell me something and I tell her very nicely that I'm in a hurry . She then rolls her eyes Ike this is my fault . Very poor customer skills  I left and went and got GREAT food at BRio in town square .  Very very poor service , I will tell all my clients and customer to not waste their time with this place .  Very sad !

yxVM1DGy8x8v-46xhCeNBw.text: This was the second time we visited this location. This time it was a bit more crowded but I had family in town and wanted them to give it try. The first time we ate there Chef Robert was on location and stopped by to talk with us; what a nice surprise. I had the duck confit that was really good. The first time I was there I had the shepherd pie that was also amazing. My wife had the the fish n chips both times and said the flavor was nice but it had more batter on the fish than was to her likings. I'm really glad they have a kids menu which we order off the first time (cheeseburger) but this time the kids slit the fish n chips.  For an appetizer we had the French onion fondue which I would not classify as a fondue but just a regular ole dip. Don't me wrong it was pretty tasty but it only came with 5 pieces of bread so we got a second helping which added 5$ to the menu. It was good but 18$ for an app was more than I really wanted to spend.  Last we hit the dessert menu. Almond cake, I don't need to order that again. It was very underwhelming. The flavor the nuts the peaches were all real flat.  Overall both trips were nice and meeting Chef Robert was awesome. Not sure that I have to go back but since I'm a veteran and Chef Robert treats us nice I probably will.

XO5of-Nyjuiox1WcPighVA.text: Nothing special about this place, and it's expensive. $23 for the Public House burger, really? What I got was worth $9. $8 for a 12 oz Guinness, please. You can get better food and drink, for better prices, across the street at the Irish Pub in the Mandalay shops. I'm a local, and won't be back.

gE8LovMylg1IvSRaWPeQ8Q.text: No wait time. Service was fast and friendly. Ruben sandwich was the best. I would highly recommend getting this. The grilled chicken sandwich was just ok that is why only 4 stars. The homemade fries were served fresh and hot.

CkQgMn8sU820NCpUPwVT9g.text: Both visits during our stay at the Tropicana went well.  The staff was friendly and attentive.  The food was good, clean, and fresh.  The price was high for the type of food served, but being that it was in a casino on the strip I did not mark off for this on the review since it would be common for the prices to be higher than norm.  In contrast the Bacio at the Tropicana was a disappointment.  Didn't have a chance to eat there because the staff decided to stop serving breakfast an hour early, after my wife stopped in and spoke to the host earlier in the morning and confirmed that breakfast would be served until 12pm - not 11:am .

Pl-0VIhomd6yfxNxXztAgg.text: Kind a pricey for what you get. The food is ok but not spectacular. Nothing you go home and write about, Had the lobster sandwich. Bread was a little stale and not a big fan of the dressing for it. My two last lobster sandwiches were from local food trucks and there were clearly better and tastier. Also had the French onion fondue. Like a mix of cheese fondue and French Onion soup aka cheese sauce with a bunch of onions in it. Hard to scoop up.  I would prefer to have those two dishes separate. The chicken wings were just as good as next door at the Hooters but priced way higher.  Last I had the crab balls. It was hard to taste the lump crab. Again many places have super delish crab cakes in town that I would much rather prefer. Best part Robert Irvine was walking around and giving photo ops. Without Robert in the room, the place is clearly over priced. They should step it up a notch or lower the price. The competition in town is tough. This would not be the first, second or third places I would go to for this kind of food. The room is really loud.

_jtdToZxkc8iuCmfos0J7w.text: Love the food and atmosphere here. This has to be one of my favorite menus on the strip. I've eaten here several times now and have not once had bad service or bad food. The attention to detail is top notch. I do have one complaint preventing me from giving it 5 stars. The atmosphere is relaxed and casual, the plates were well thought out for the presentation, the table layout is very comfortable. For some reason they choose not to have salt and pepper on the tables??? I requested some and they brought me 2 little shakers that looked as if they were purchased right off  the shelf at the local Piggly Wiggly. I was impressed with the fact that the salt seemed to be a higher quality sea salt or kosher salt. Too bad it wouldn't come out of the shaker as the little holes in the tin cap were too small. Fix this Mr. Irvine and I will be happy to slap 5 stars on this review. I love your food and staff!

qUlS3aSR8dQWvGrHxIfcEg.text: We were very impressed with the restaurant.  The atmosphere was great for a Pub, and the chairs very comfortable.  We started with the Punch and it was good but expensive for the small cocktail.  We had the cheese/onion fondue which was good.  We shared the burger that had ham and egg on it, delicious, and the PLT which was good. We ended with the banana pie, which was very good.  I really would give it 3 1/2 stars but couldn't so I gave it 4 stars for the service and atmosphere.

j-ENo9k9KiheeYRhn4bq_A.text: Juan, our bartender/server and Hans who I believe was an assistant provided exemplary service. From the moment we sat down at the bar, we were given everything one hopes for when they go out to eat. They were prompt, attentive, and full of information about the restaurant, and all its offerings. While we debated about what to order, Juan suggested something my girlfriend and I had both been looking at, so we ordered it. The burger was made with Creekstone Farms beef which is exceptional, deep fried bacon, sauteed mushrooms and onions, green tomato and lettuce shavings served on a brioche bun and offered with an insane fondue to pour over the burger.  We have been residing in Vegas for two years now, and this was absolutely one of if not our best experiences at any restaurant.  This place is a very fun environment one can plan to either sit and have a nice meal, or sit at the bar as we did, and enjoy great food, sample some wonderful beers, and receive the type of service so few restaurants offer anymore. We absolutely will be back, and recommend this spot to anyone either in town for a vacation or any local seeking a nice new place for some great food and beer.  Thank you again Juan, and Hans for making it a memorable evening!

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

T9S9r1spVH-tq6YzeDu2lQ.text: I thought it was very over priced. I paid $65 for a chicken sandwich, a salad, and 2 drinks. I know this is Vegas but damn. Chicken sandwich was just ok.

fA0aWcPgIg7A4UMu4iE_NA.text: We loved the food, atmosphere was relaxed.  While dining here Robert Irvine himself was there! He came to our table and asked how we were doing, then asked if we wanted us and our 2 kids to join him in the kitchen to make our own dessert!! He personally gave us a tour of the kitchen and then taught our kids how to make fresh donuts, step by step!!! It was one of the coolest family night out we have ever had! Robert Irvine was so wonderful and kind... this is a night we will never forget!

-qIZNpb_w68NgYlFrVpuxA.text: Never heard of Robert Irvine and I know there's two other Public House's on the strip (Luxor & Venetian).  But, judging by the size of his photo on the side of the Tropicana tower, he must be a big deal.  If you're wondering where the restaurant is located, just stand outside and walk towards the Hooters Casino next door.  PH is hard to miss as it looks like the newest construction to the Trop in 60 years.  Here there's plenty of parking and it's free.  The restaurant's really nice and with plenty of space.  Right up front is the U-shaped bar area with two dozen or so taps easily in sight.  Next to that is a wide lounge area great for parties.  When I was here, there was a bachelorette party next to a group from a convention.  There's even shuffleboard.  There's so many tables in the dining area, you probably won't need to worry about reservations.  There was so much good stuff on the menu, I couldn't decide and was taking forever.  So I just went with the F&K Burger ($22) which had crispy bacon, caramelized onions, and mushrooms.  It did not disappoint.  Juicy and topped with a fluffy shell of a bun.  I also went with the Ahi Tuna Sashimi ($17) which was nice light dish and tasted so fresh.  As my food was coming out, I did some Yelping and I really wanted that Miso Salmon, but was sad to see it wasn't on the menu.  Guess I'll have to come back for that. and the steak. and the pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. F&amp;K Burger ($22)

vjwe4xG2yxoA_2AXByfGUg.text: Good casual restaurant. The atmosphere is relaxing, and stuff is very nice and friendly. When I wanted to order a corn chowder soup and asked if it's not spicy, the waiter brought a sample for me to try. It was, so I ordered baked whipped ricotta and didn't regret about it. That was delicious. Afterwards I had salmon entree which was also very good. My husband was less lucky: he ordered a burger, but he was brought a wrong one. We were in rush to catch the flight, and we got a right one very fast with apologies. I appreciate such an attitude. I would go back here again when I will be next time in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon nicoise entree
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious baked whipped ricotta

xSuaq5kuYLFlA9j_Roaczw.text: A chef that has a TV show based on revamping bad restaurants may need to take his own advise. The food was worse than average, and we only had apps. Lack of flavor and uniqueness. It was all food I could have made at home. I was expecting a special Chef Irvine twist on these dishes, but no. Also at dinner time there were no customers just us and two tables. You can get better food elsewhere.

p4FM0dFSu99ZyoreU2Rz-A.text: Wanted a casual girls night and we found a great pub hangout away from the crowds. Shuffle board, VGK hockey, long list of brews and an All American menu. We had the all white chicken and broccoli pizza ( great for people who don't like broccoli). Now who would have thought broccoli works on pizza? It does! Had the steak chimachurri, nicely seasoned and cooked perfectly. Staff is very attentive. Dining is casual. You got 3 screens off the bar to watch your games. Here's some advice- get larger screens like 80 inch-you'll attract that sports crowd that goes with the brewery. Dessert had the toffee pie- highly recommended. Great for groups. Also would recommend a happy hour menu please.

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1OS3lyq6X1N2tmFvPCBXeg.text: I wasn't impressed but will give it another try.  The skinny fries with bacon and feta-not very good. The French fries were not freshly prepared and really had to search for the few and oh so tiny pieces of bacon. The hummus was good, not great. And I cannot believe I'm giving a wedge salad a bad review!  The salad dressing had little flavor and the bacon or pork was extremely fatty with a strange flavor.    Was just disappointed with what I ordered but will consider a return visit to try something else.

JZ7fV_ftid2YDh3Fk33hDA.text: We stopped by and did a quick bite on a work day night, food is typical American style, but really tasty. We grad some salad, wings and a turkey plate, I like the wings very much, it is really crispy outside and tender in side, very flavored, highly recommend their wings

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

khuIrXw6_H0jmdbjCjvhRw.text: Absolutely impressed with this place.  Warm, inviting right inside the Tropicana.  Greeted immediately as I walked in and sat at the bar.  Came at an odd time- 3:00 pm so probably got great service because of it but my food was absolutely amazing!!  There was flavor, a little spice, acid and richness.  This dish was so well balanced and seasoned spot on.  The only critique I could find is the potatoes were a little hard.  By the way I ordered the salmon dish.  Oh and it had warm black olives in it which I absolutely love.  I was not sure how I would like them in there but they complimented it very well.  Juan was my server and such a friendly guy with a sweet smile that lightened up the room.  This is a definite treasure for the Tropicana!!!

cLPOtjqIWu2XrNZeykiDrg.text: We ate at public house a week ago and really loved the wedge salad, the sliders, and my husband had a burger and fries that were outstanding.  The menu is slightly limited but good.  I would love to know how to make the salad dressing on the wedge salad.  Best ever.

_aN_zxBVigynHaezSQJCTg.text: Not impressed. Ordered the rib ends and they were very tough to eat and fatty. The salmon was recommended so we orderd 2 of those, brussell sprouts weren't cooked all the way and salmon was a little over done. Others in our party ordered the burger which he was pleased with and the other person ordered the fish n chips that she didn't finish so I'm not to sure. I notified the waiter of the situation with the rib tips and nothing was done. For the over price and value of the meal I wasn't satisfied. But, I always give something a second chance so maybe if we stay there on the next trip will consider. But, save you money the Bacio is a better place to eat.

vzd-Stw_8N-A3pTGZrVBPg.text: Originally I tried to book this place for one of our corporate meals for 23 people, but they could only offer a set menu with 2 or maybe 3 entrees. It wasn't enough choice for us but we were sad to miss the experience. Luckily half the team stayed an extra day and we were able to make a reservation and eat from the regular menu. They aren't listed on open table and are kind of hard to find on the internet as there are other Public House that come up first.  But it was fairly simple to make a reservation.  Service was very friendly and attentive.   First, I ordered the spicy martini. Ita a delicious blend of Serrano pepper vodka and pineapple and orange juice. This is a great cocktailI. It definitely had a strong kick but very delicious. Three other people tried it because I was raving about it and agreed. Then, I ordered liver & onions (but with no onion) and was not disappointed. Liver was tender and very flavorful. One of the best liver & onions I've had. Ambiance is nice but casual. I'll definitely be back.

y7KDV7qLhFTBCMz_mQjivg.text: Ki made the restaurant good to great. Our first night in we had the fish and chips. Wow, the chips (fries) were absolutely delicious and the flavors combined... a curry aioli?? Oh yes. Yes. YES! Ki had a genuine smile and truly seemed to care about each of the tables she had. We got our bill and were surprised there was already a gratuity for just the two of us. We broke our own rule and tipped up to what we normally would have.   We returned the next night and asked to sit in her area. As soon as we sat down she came over, "I am so glad you came back! I don't know what happened last night. I am so sorry that the gratuity was on your bill!!!" She was embarrasses by the mistake and was just as fantastic as the night before.   This time I had the skirt steak that was prepared wonderfully and upgraded my fries to the deliciousness of the night before.   If I'm staying at the Tropicana again I will come back. Not just for Ki, but also for the food. Who am I kidding? I'll be back when I know Ki is there!!

H2x7bK9P3EZY7ykaqLHE2w.text: Has been on our list, we love his show on the Food Network. Service was very good, food was great!!!! Will definitely return! An amazing spot to bring out of town guests, or if you're looking for a fun night out.  One of the cleanest restaurants I've ever been in, lots of games, fun atmosphere.

iJgx_axS--jne2HGRQHYnQ.text: Food was excellent. Only thing that would make me not give a 5 is the poor first impression and lack of substitution. I was in a party of 2, and before me were 2 groups waiting at host stand. No host there. We stood and stood. Finally after a lady walked to the bar someone showed up. 2 hosts finally came up. One was great the other was a crabby young lady that had no smile - no greeting. I ordered fish and chips and make simple ask to sub vegetables for fries. No go. Waited said the chef does not allow it - not Chef Irvine but the local chef due to complicated prices. The fries were good but I wanted to try veggies since I had poutine for app which was excellent. Overall great food. Focus on the customer more.

TUtEBE5fTLXs8HjOFP-v-Q.text: So I'm a foodie, executive chef and a restaurant owner so I ordered way too much food, but here is the lowdown.  We start off with the garlic Parmesan rolls they are fresh baked and a iron skillet and the quinoa chicken soup. The soup is one of the best around, like o my god good, well done chef, my only thought is, why the saltines with the soup and not a Parmesan roll is it a nostalgic thing?   For our dinner we got the Robert and Gina sausage chili pizza and the carbonara mac & cheese the Burrata Nevada stone salad and cucumber tomato side salad.  You know Chef Irvine is not going to disappoint and it would be "Impossible" for it to be bad.   I think the soup and Burrata salad were my favorites.  This is a place I will be coming back quite often and if your visiting Las Vegas this is a must visit I give it 1 Michelin star!

Mz6Tdg3cownLah5XImnpNg.text: Salt and pepper shakers were backwards, nothing we ordered was as specified, bread was burnt on sandwich, hamburger was nearly raw.  When these flaws were pointed out-rather than fixing in the kitchen we were brought replacement parts.  So basically we made our own meals.  Lesson learned in Vegas-if it has a well-known name attached-avoid like the plague as we had a similar experience at Emeril's.

Pl3Mo08S72cjzA-kSfVI5Q.text: Overpriced for lack luster service and mediocre food. I have tried three times to like this place.  I have only repeated because I was staying at the hotel and they were long work days.

p6WlX8hJ2_72mMR-gNP5Kg.text: Service was EXCELLENT, however, the food was bland and had minimal flavor. I will say the bread pudding was DELICIOUS!!!

fkWK9o5IOgm4tKJtFDknww.text: Not the greatest experience. Went for lunch with my family. Pricey to begin with. The waiter had zero personality. There was a bug in my wedge salad. Alive. Waiter told me it's because they use organic lettuce. ?? The manager never stopped by and they attempted to charge me for the bug infested salad. As we were leaving not one person said goodbye. The hostesses we gabbing to each other and never looked up. The place was empty. The only reason I gave them three stars is they have VGK Vintage hockey arcade game and the floors look cool.

oKTMpecllIa3WiJ_u_jmRg.text: Very disappointed,  service was good but you can see there is a issue in the kitchen took almost a half hour to get a salad a burger and the mahi mahi sandwich. Burger was good the salad I could of did better at home and the mahi mahi sandwich was good but needs a better bun and the fries were cold.

Yxg8QcYqk1wA7hALtZML7Q.text: We stopped here for a few drinks and apps. By far, the best buffalo wings and pizza we've had. The Parmesan fries are out of this world. Great beer selection. If you like IPA's try the Space Dust, you won't be disappointed.

ZcV3YUg9HsmiNRNNqKxAag.text: Over priced !!!   Service good   Just another restaurant don't waste your time or money

Ui6pWqpYc8u_EdWEICTN6g.text: Great service! Beef Guinness Pie and lamb Shepherds Pie were delicious! Met our St Pat's Day meal requirement 2 days early!

PAIQlVkAEOPWqt6EjQ2FeQ.text: A great selection of beers and shout out to the bartender "M...".  She is friendly and helpful for food selection.  Pub food is good and average price in the location.  However, the hostess need to pay more attention to the guest walking in to the restaurant. No greeting in or out, other than our awesome bartender.

CP917yKAxsTggVwzYIEUNw.text: Horrible overpriced food and drinks. Find another place to eat. So disappointed. Burger was bleh and Bloody Mary was watered down.

9cCZkg6GDYVvdbz3KN8NwA.text: I really enjoyed our meal here. I loved my Effin Irvine cocktail and my BLT wedge salad to which I added the grilled salmon. Salmon was moist and cooked perfectly. Husband had fish and chips which he thought was terrific.  Service was great and I like the open kitchen concept. We will definately come back. It always amuses me when folks bitch about the prices. You are on the Strip so yes food is more expensive but compared to other restaurants I thought the prices weren't that bad to be honest.

WtMTfbDXjA9vuPKwHaSYpw.text: A 2nd-tier restaurant at a 2nd-tier hotel. Disappointing overall. Food was good but service not so much. Long periods of time when we couldn't get anyone to come over to the table. The place had an overall shabby feel, sort of like a Shoney's in Virginia.

QWDntJoDQZAC-kDEHXveVQ.text: The burgers are fabulous- the meat is absolutely first class.  However, they pour cheese sauce (very good by the way) over the burger so you can't pick it up.  Fries dipped in cheese sauce were very good.  Deserts were all great.  I'll go back.

ZuuCBWNFue1O40v8dwMrPw.text: Great fish and Chips an pizza. Great service all. All the wait staff pitched in. Would recommend it an will go again. Not to bad of prices for Vagas

w8fBCU8CGC-L8wsz7kCe1g.text: Had a great dinner here last night. The service was prompt and friendly. The food was delicious. Our bartender Jeremy made a delicious margarita. It turns out he was quite a hero (my interpretation not his) the night of the Mandalay Bay shootings and helped the victims who had run into the Tropicana.  As he was sharing his story he mentioned how it has changed his outlook on life, eat that ice cream. Have that extra glass of wine, you never know. At that moment I decided to order the Pulled Pork cavatappi. I waS going to stay with my healthy low carb choices but changed my mind and I'm so glad I did. It was fabulous. The bbq sauce was so good, the pork was tender and the "Mac & cheese" Mmmmmmmm!  Thanks Jeremy!  Jiovanni our waiter was also very nice and attentive.  Good job, Robert Irvine!

DOyIPHijy71BKOlKXfNLtA.text: Service was friendly and food was good. Not overpriced for a strip restaurant. Good selection of beer.

stgOn8Cuekg-hLaQmV8WZQ.text: Not impressed, sorry to say. Atmosphere is good lots of beer choices but my food was a big disappointment, I order my meet medium rare and it was almost well done. About average all around.

tTLP6PrGGF4oYzjbWxcHOA.text: Love Love Love your Mahi Mahi Sandwich.  I can't say enough.  We were in your restaurant and ordered it and BOOM!  Amazing.  We came back the next day and ordered it again.  It's light (like... you can have a good walk after) and refreshing.  Excellent!  Can't say enough good things about this sandwich and the experience.  Kudos x10!

MUDtkEB2Ut8dos9HbiBqAQ.text: Went back a second time to completely regret the first review! Loved it, got the same thing in addition to the goat cheese dip. Wow, coming back every time I come to Vegas even if I dont stat at the Tropicana!

DW363RqBcXZv_QRExJR55A.text: The food is exceptionally delicious! Once I come out of my food euphoria, I might update this review to say more. But really, all you need to know is the food is GOOD!
