BG8WH4Rz-oiWp3Q3CZ4xVQ.text: My family had burgers which they said were delicious. I had the fish and chips- Fish was bland and the batter not good. Overpriced too. I liked the restaurant atmosphere though and the servers were very nice. Hope they improve the flavor of the fish and chips!

nI0uZzykeu76SSL1MteDqg.text: I am so bummed writing this review. Made a reservation for my dads birthday. Went to the host who seated us promptly. Sat down and our server came and told us the specials and offered the drink selection. We ordered drinks and waited. We got our drinks which were all jverpriced but it's the strip. That's ok, we know what we were in for coming to the strip. We ordered our food and after waiting 45 minutes, nothing. We ordered oysters and salads which didn't show up. It's not even busy !! Soon it reached an hour with not only no food, but no sign of our waiter. We soon located our waiter and asked for the bill. No apology just left. Soon we were greeted by some random person but whom we can only assume was the manager for a haphazard "sorry and that if we want to come back after the  hockey game we will take care of you". No clue the guys name or title since he decided to leave that piece out. What an awful place. Everyone around us was served, even individuals whom came after us and it wasn't even busy!!!. Don't come here if you would like to actually eat. Just come for drinks, at least you'll be served those before they forget about you.

140oogRjzyzwT2JMqWMjwg.text: This IS the spot to catch a nice lunch when you're in the area. The food..impeccable!  From the time you walk in the door you're greeted by a very friendly hostess. The atmosphere is awesome and the staff of managers will come over and ask where you're from in a very welcoming manner!  Special shoutouts go to my waiter Fred the busboy Roberto and the more than friendly Marcos!  Thanks so much for an outstanding experience and the chefs.. thanks for some great food !!!!  Hilda

OBTZGHRoBXHou3uCABvI8g.text: Service was terribly slow.  6:30pm - no chicken at all.   No pizzas.  Literally out of half the menu - never again.

p7AU2HBRLOzWVpPwHLojUQ.text: Brand new and inside the Tropicana Hotel and Casino lay a wonderful eating experience. I kept it simple with the Heirloom Gazpacho and Spring Greens Salad. Simple and yet so very good. The Gazpacho was bold and vibrant, but add in the pineapple sorbet and it becomes a delicate balance of flavors that surprised me. The salad? I'd never heard of watermelon radishes, they do have a peppery flavor you would expect, but it's also unexpected. I really enjoyed the whole experience and recommend this wonderful restaurant and the staff that makes it even better. A must try when in Las Vegas!

nlSJCJVGLth_GscPe-hsMA.text: Amazing food, great atmosphere all the employees are friendly and willing to help. We will definitely be back.

pcro_9kiQT_dI-mbwk0w2Q.text: Unbelievable experience both with the staff and food. First the price is very reasonable and the food is delicious. The staff was always there if need but not intrusive. If not the best dining experience in Vegas one of top

wKLl_Pmwox7yHdXBbFbP6w.text: I had such an amazing experience at Robert Irvine's Public House! Our waiter and the chef greeted us warmly and made our entire stay so memorable. The waiter continued to have great recommendations on the menu. First I was pleased with a bourbon old fashioned that was so tasty. He recommended the fondue plate with cheese that melted in my mouth! Then we were delighted to experience a surprise cheese platter with warm bread and delish fig jams! When we moved on to the main course, steak and frites which was cooked to perfection! To finish it off we had some amazing coffee with a banana cake! I had such a great time and I will absolutely go back!!

_PfYx-rMRKKDdGqHB8vFgw.text: If you are fortunate enough to sit at the bar, ask for Jeremy! Great personality, fabulous service, and he KNOWS The menu!  The food is great, and you should absolutely stop and eat here if you are in Vegas!!!

ps8D2g_MnM5lv19qwl1J2Q.text: This place is awesome and the service was flawless. I had the Shepherds Pie and it was amazing!

k9unhD8JLzDGov70J39z1w.text: Great atmosphere and friendly service.  Excellent selection of beer.  The Blue Flame Chicken burger was interesting and tasty.  The Carrot Cake to top this off was the best however.  Would definitely return to try one of the other burgers.

FMLoTtVCq_iVtlVvk4tvew.text: I will say that I NEVER order liver and onions at a restaurant because it would be very hard to meet my expectations- I grew up having fresh cow liver made by my Mom. I had confidence in Chef Irvine so I took a leap of faith and ordered it off the menu. Soooooo happy that I did.  Sorry, Mom, but this was THE BEST liver and onions I have ever had !!!! Husband had the Guinness shepherds pie and said it was good. House salad was a perfect size. Ordered the lemon curd dessert and the meringue topping was dreamy. Our waitress was very nice. The only reason I gave it 4 stars was because some of the timing was off. We got our entrees very fast ( almost too fast ) but then waited for drinks to be refilled and waited for entree plates to be picked up and waited longer for our desserts than we did for the entree and then waited for check. Very clean, Tropicana not my favorite but you don't have to walk in very far to get to the restaurant. Likes the music playing also. Will definitely come back. Oh husband had the mason jar apple pie and ate every bite. I couldn't finish my lemon curd dessert, it was really more a 2-person dessert. Has the blueberry mule cocktail, very good. Hubby enjoyed Robert's margarita.

DO0dWS_pMU0MujviYoTWbQ.text: I was excited to try Robert Irvine's since we were staying at the Tropicana and the food choices are somewhat limited.  As a vegetarian. I asked if they had a separate menu for vegetarians/vegans. The host said no, but they could customized a few options and she told us to ask our server.  So we went in, we were shown to a lower table with the most uncomfortable chairs ever. (The  frame of the chairs were made out of some sort of hard wood, I guess.  They didn't hardly have much of a back to them and the arms came up really high.) I asked the server for options that she could recommend for me.  She said we don't have many, this is mostly a meat place.  We should  have left then, since it seemed like my questioned annoyed her. I knew my husband was tired and hungry, so we stayed.  I ordered the BLT with cheddar cheese/without the bacon and a side salad with no cucumbers. My side salad was full of cucumbers. The BLT looked like one you would get from Sonic, but worse.  I basically got texas looking toast that they called brioche bread with some shredded iceberg lettuce, a few sprinkles of  some sort of shredded cheese, one tomato slice and a little bit of avocado mayonnaise.  I wished I would have taken a picture, but I didn't. I was so busy looking at this $15.00 sandwich that I was going to force myself to eat.  I scraped off the iceberg lettuce, which the little bit of the cheese that I had came off with it.  (I really expected much more from a celebrity chef's restuarant)  I would have been ashamed to have served that sandwich to anyone.  So my husband ordered the Shepard's Pie.  It was the worst Shepard's Pie that he has every had. (He was actually feeling ill for the rest of the night). Then we  go ahead and ordered the peach cheesecake, thinking something had to be good.   The cheesecake was actually the only thing that was good.  Not sure how most of  the other reviews are glowing, but we will never eat there again.  It seemed like the only people that were happy there were the ones sitting at the bar.   It  was our worst meal that we had in our 6 day Vegas stay.

MZ-SnaiM7gotzL1I-ANYaA.text: We had dinner here on 9/4/17.  The food was very good!  We had the chicken wings for an appetizer.  They were awesome.  Loved the sauce and even the bread that the wings were on was great soaked in the sauce.  Spouse had the burger that comes with the cheese sauce either poured over it or on the side if you prefer.  He ordered it medium rare and that's how it came out.  He totally enjoyed it even though it was really out of his comfort zone.  I ordered the blackened Mahi. Wow, was that good. I would order that again for sure.  I'm not a beer lover so I had a margarita, it was well made.  The service was really attentive, even a bit over attentive as we had 3 different people check on us but I'm not complaining.  The only reason it's not 5 stars is the cost of the alcohol is too high in my opinion.  Some of the beer prices are good but if you don't drink beer the drinks are pretty high for what I consider on the small size. But I would certainly go back for the food.  I'm glad I convinced my spouse to try it since he is one who  is pretty traditional about food and when we first looked at the place when we arrived at the Tropicana he was not interested in trying it.

VTUcmq10JxF_93jEg7ZB3w.text: Don't let the name fool you.  It's just ok.  For a famous chef was expecting something a little better.  I've went their twice cause everyone has a bad day.  But the second time was ok.  Food is way overpriced.  Plus I was playing in the casino and was going to go eat an had a drink in my hand and the said "no outside drinks are allowed".  Are you kidding me.  Your restaurant is in a casino!  What do you expect.  You mean to tell me if you spending money on the casino floor and you have a drink in your hand they turn you away.  To me that's BS.  But my dumb ass gave them a 3rd try.  It was 3:45 in the afternoon.  And they gave me this little card with very few options and nothing on there was good.  They didn't even have a salad on the menu.  Then the hostess said you can sit anywhere but then she came over and said.  Oh I'm sorry you can only sit at the bar right now cause we're not open for dinner yet.  Bottom line is.  For a celebrity with his name on this establishment is not making him look good.  Oh.  And by the way.  I went there at 10:15 and the yelp review said they closed in 11.  I went there to order some wings to go and they said that they closed early but online they said they were open till 11.  Please don't go here.  Go to the M resort. Their is a free shuttle from the Tropicana.   Better food.  Better staff and more options for the same price.  I'm a local.  I know the difference

U9MQbLbVQvLji31UEryCbg.text: Public House had amazing food and was reasonably priced. I tried a little of everything. It was very delicious. The staff was also amazing. Tropicana Hotel has been doing a tremendous job lately.

HcWewoc11XMTeGbD2tCttA.text: If anyone has ever been to Vegas, they know how difficult it is to choose a restaurant due to the vast selection. We were in the South Strip area and decided to check it out. The establishment is located inside the Tropicana right off the casino on the main level. It was 7pm on a Friday night but not as busy as expected, especially since it was Labor Day weekend. Our server Fred was awesome. Very attentive and had good recommendations. The menu is small but great selections nonetheless. We started with poutine. Unlike the traditional version, tater tots were used in place of fries. The gravy was a pulled pork and shiitake onion gravy with peppered goat cheese. All the flavors really complimented each other well. For entrees I opted for Stone Fired Shepherds Pie and my boyfriend had the Hickory Smoked Chicken Wings. All were Robert Irvine's signature dishes. The shepherds pie, was good and exactly what I expected it to taste like. The minced lamb had a good flavor and the mashed potato crust was light and fluffy yet toasted just enough on top. My boyfriends wings had great flavor but his only complaint was that they were only luke warm. He hates to complain so we really aren't sure if the way they are cooked had something to do with the temperature since they are hickory smoked and not fried? He loved them nonetheless and we would return again if ever in the area.

TL7ExRKtnCkJN7Rkdfvm_A.text: Probably some of the best chicken wings and I've ever had. I ordered them simply because it said it was his signature sauce, could have been more True, absolutely awesome.

S2sCCG24m4j2XI3xL8zYaQ.text: My sisters and I had reservations here to celebrate a birthday.  We highly anticipated our meal and couldn't wait to go.  Sadly, we were disappointed in so many ways. The water being spilled on us by the bus boy should have been an omen. Our server tried very hard ro keep us happy as we waited over for our entree.  No bread, crackers or anything were offered as we waited.  Fifteen minutes before our meal arrived we were told it was being plated.  Finally our chicken came that we were all sharing and it was fair at best.  Vegetables were fair. Certainly not worth the long wait.  We were told that the chicken dish takes 45 minutes - that should be clearly stated on menu or mentioned by the waiter.  We asked to talk to manager whose attitude was ambivalent at best. Will not return will discourage anyone I know from going

UoIA8aKgG9Ndtzhv3TEpxw.text: Would give 0 stars. Service absolutely sucks.  Sat at bar- got menu right away but then didn't get "noticed" for over 10 minutes. Then when finished with a beer and wings (glass empty); I put my credit card out hoping they'd notice that but no difference. Took over twenty minutes for one of the two working (bar was less than half full) for one to notice and asked if I wanted another beer. Really? This is service you'd see on one of the namesakes show. What a joke. Will never come back again next time in town. Doubt it'll be around based on the other reviews.

XQ9RDOe23jJGqI-6JW7e8A.text: I was really surprised by the menu. It's super unique. I did make reservations because it is Las Vegas and it's alway busy at celebrity chef places. We were greeted and seated promptly. I was able to order a Bloody Mary even tho it wasn't on the menu. We had delicious chicken wings as an appetizer. Cooked perfectly and has a delicious sauce. The best burger I have had ever was here! It's the a fondue burger. Delicious,  the beef is seasoned to perfection, panko crusted bacon, melty cheese on a toasted brioche bun!  Go get this burger ASAP. Staff is friendly and the restaurant is pretty large. Wished there could have been some Robert Irvine shows playing in the background. He is the face of the place. Can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tUXotfeAEYllDpdv5PrSRg.text: My husband and I sat at the bar and watched the World Series while we ate dinner. The  service from the bartenders was stellar, and yet he did not rush us when the bar and restaurant got pretty full. The food was delicious, although the hamburger was a bit overpriced.  (Even a gourmet burger on brioche with fondue dip and fries is a little pricey at $21) I had a  kale salad that was fantastic. The bar offers a huge selection of beers, plus a few cocktails and wine selections. We had a dessert that was also extremely good. We highly recommend this restaurant.

yJqn4a1lkkHR64TOBez5FQ.text: So I would like to start off by saying that any new restaurant have some kinks they need to iron out within the first few months so some of the reviews maybe should wait til then. The service was impeccable. The hostess was very nice and our server Raquel was personable as well as charming. The food was great. Shoestring fries were perfect way to start off with our drinks. Wood oven pizza, fig goat cheese and prosciutto was delicious. And the blue-cheese cake very usual and pleasantly velvety. The Irish coffee was probably the best I have had in a long while. I wish I was out here longer because I would love to try more items off the menu!!

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ilucmg-H6cjCA9SPzMP7HA.text: Here right now on a college football Saturday afternoon. Gave this place a second chance. Took 20 minutes to get the beer I ordered. The nachos are bone dry and they're was barely any pulled pork on them. Poor Service and even worse food! Never again!

WKIWFnn9BzfyhpxJO8Ra-g.text: Very casual which is nice, well designed interiors ~      This is a new restaurant on "The Strip" so that was our reason to try, & neither myself or husband had been inside the Tropicana....... nicer than I expected and had been modernized, SURPRISE! and The Trop offers free parking so that's a PLUS also        Let's start with drinks ~ we each ordered "specialty" cocktails. A Rum punch for me and a Libra something for the hubby. Both were pricy, to be expected on the Strip, however it seemed to take awhile to get our drinks (and the restaurant/bar wasn't anywhere near full,) Saturday night 6pm ~ this is early for Vegas!!! Anyway the drinks appear.....mine looked like a mini cocktail, I even commented, which I don't do, but I felt this was outrageous! My cocktail tasted good, just small ~ my husbands drink was good and a more fitting size for the price $$$$$      APPETIZERS ~ we ordered the Lump Crab  Aranchini, just SUBERB! And we were both surprised how crispy golden brown served with a SIRACHA sauce (wasn't scorching & and I am a hot sauce sissy!) DEFINITELY ORDER THESE      The Heirloom Tomato  Salad, beautifully presented and tasted as DEEELISSSH as it looked looked! Ofcourse Heirloom Tomatoes are seasonal so beware what time of year this is on the menu~      Main Courses ~ were DELIVERED before we were half way finished with the Heirloom Tomato Salad.......the food runner stood there as wee looked at him kinda surprised......then he asked IF we wanted him to take it back???? We said no, fearing our plates would be placed under heat lamps plus my fish & chips couldn't survive a reheat  we did mention this to our server, who seemed appalled ~ well HELLLLOO, it's the servers fault! Not the kitchen, as the server keys in the order and needs to time their tickets~      I had the Fish  & Chips  ~ this was not something I would usually order however the menu was limiting for my tastes ~      The coating on the fish was malted beer batter and served golden brown~ on the menu it comes with a curry sauce, which I asked for on the side....thank goodness as I think it would have made the fried crust mushy (Ewww!) PLUS we not curry people. I did try the sauce, it was OK, mustard like with curry. Remember this is an English Pub style eatery and the English do like curry..... still seems odd curry or Mustard with fish.      My Husband had The Skirt Steak served with chips (fries) & asparagus ~ the presentation was Ok & he said is was alright~      We did not order a dessert, however did see many passing by....appeared to be GENEROUS in size ~       The wait staff were eager.....always asking to clear our plates while still eating....this is a training issue ~ constantly filling barely touched water glasses ~ our server was very eager to give us his card once he learned we were locals, like BEFORE we got our cocktails, so we could ask for him upon our return.   Overall I don't see going back for a meal, and would order a different cocktail,  however the apps/Salad were all worth it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The ENTRANCE from inside the Tropicana
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside area

vmpyGruJRc59BiyV1SA3LA.text: We had the French onion fondue which was excellent.  Our main courses were the beet salad and the three cheese pizza covered in arugula.  Everything was tasty, fresh, and served quickly and with a smile! The fondue was the star; quite yummy.

8XNjp2dqlQDjA0TN3qrRDQ.text: RI did not disappoint! Food was delicious and service was great. Restaurant was clean and bar was spectacular!! This is one place we were especially excited to visit when we came to Vegas, we will be back to try more food here.  Thanks for the experience!

zlcpOX23GsgduoknfB-W6Q.text: Tried this new restaurant for the first time tonight  and liked it a lot. Delicious menu options to choose from, and friendly staff. I tried the Watermelon Cooler cocktail which was delicious (I had 2), and the steak and frites, which was a huge portion of skirt steak. The chimichurri sauce is awesome!  My husband had the fondue burger which was so unique and totally delicious. It has fried bacon on it. Fried bacon!!  For dessert my dad presented the apple pie in a mason jar. I am gluten free and while it was not on the menu they accommodated an affogato. I would definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and frites
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Affogato
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mason jar apple pie

IN4bO4vIUN4p4y44uTkZ0g.text: Loud.  TVs and people's voices bouncing all around in there (poor acoustics).  Hard to converse over dinner without sitting close and straining your ears and voice and I found it pretty stressful actually and headache inducing.  Wasn't over the top decibel-wise but the acoustics make it like a bass trap- like a bad seat at a concert- mushy rumble.  I wondered if that is a similar tactic as the casinos with all the noisy slots etc.  like maybe 'eat and split'?  Table was very wobbly too which was a turn off for a 'kind of high end' joint.    Food was good but I thought the fries were supposed to be seasoned(?).   Our two dishes seemed like they had a variety of flavors jammed in there.  This spice, that sauce plus this herb and that garnish.  I dunno. I think I would have better things to say about the food if the environment wasn't dominating the experience.     App and two meals $70. (No drinks for us.). The previous night we chilled at the pizza place down the hall and had great conversation.  I think I enjoyed that more because less expectations.   Cheers.

sc_RC7vtCkItpodv_Vtk3g.text: Like most things on the strip and especially when you attach a celebrities name to it, the prices are about 25% more than what they should be.   Atmosphere is relaxed yet meh at the same time.  I would say it's more of a gastropub than a public house.  They have a wide selection of cold beers which is highly welcome.  The bar staff has always been prompt and friendly and does at times become a challenge to find a seat at.  Good spot for drinks.  The one thing they are lacking is a decent happy hour.  Well, they'd have to have one for it to be decent.  The only resemblance of a happy hour is mediocre at best drink specials during games.    Lots of places on the strip have good happy hours, this is not one of them.

cBg7JBgy9bt0O01HI2ZN0A.text: EVERYTHING is AMAZING, and the SERVERS are superb, I love ARIEL the bartender he's on it!!!  EVERY PLATE is ABUNDANT with DELICIOUSNESS and SATISFACTION!!!   i have been several times and have tried half the menu.. STEAK TARTAR taste fresh beyond fresh.  the FRIED CRAB BALL appetizer was soooo yummy! moist, tasty and big chunks of crab, so mouth watering!   SHEPARD'S PIE with LAMB? i just got to try, i thought, eww... i was wrong!  this is the PERFECT combination!!! it is served in it's own cast iron pan, and OMG!! superb!! I ONLY want Lamb in my Shepard's Pie FROM NOW ON!!! I WANT ANOTHER ONE NOW!!  the SKIRT STEAK..... gimme love... aw man.... and the fries?  too much...   the CHICKEN SANDWICH? say no more .... hands down... BEST chickie sandie EVER!  big chunk of brie and something sweet and avo and fries.... and HEAVEN... and i want this every day for lunch!!! like e-v-e-r-y-d-a-y.    Can't go wrong with the desserts, pick one? they're great.  ARIEL provides super amazing attentiveness, which I love.... if i lived in vegas, i'd be super huge, and super happy.  Highly Recommend!!! in fact, it's a MUST TRY!!!  (you'll thank me) XOXO!

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CSg2oRTBNeeAxzFkhKkzaA.text: I was sort of excited to eat here while staying at the Tropicana. I ordered the Shepard's Pie and the Lump Crab appetizer.  The Shepard's Pie came  in a cast iron skillet. It was so hot I almost burnt my tongue. Ha to wait a few mins to let it cool down. So I ate the lump crab balls in the mean time.  The crab balls were OK, more like a crab cake but round like a takoyaki ball. Not sure if it was worth the $17. But this is Vegas and a Signature Chef's restaurant. Finally got to start on the Pie. It was also OK nothing to write home about. I've had a better Pie else where, Costco, for much less. It was so filling I could not finish it myself.   The pastrami looked tempting as well, but it looked more like a Ruben, though technically a Ruben is a Pastrami with sauerkraut and cheese.   Being this was a Robert Irvine Signature restaurant, I was expecting more, but it was somewhat average and over priced, like double. I would have given 5 stars if it met and overcame my expectations. To me it was a somewhat disappointing experience. Average overpriced food gets an average rating.

u4NU3Nnb-puqHnA6MklGVQ.text: Ordered a fondue burger with difficulty in deciding how to eat a burger with the cheese topping making it very squishy to eat

xuFPyjyRyWXxKK-Z5SQ9jg.text: The service was great; however, the food was lacking taste, the fish and chips was the worst we ever tasted.  So disappointed that you (Robert) being from England the fish seemed to be frozen when cooked.  We spend over $100 for lunch for this tasteless food. Chef Robert should pay closer attention to his own restaurants.  I try to stay away from making bad reviews, but this was so bad that I had to make one.  The 2 starts is for the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels &amp; Frites
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish &amp; Chips
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Japanese Yellowtail Poke

np4tOJKYk2kYlBzIebvmOA.text: If possible I would give this rating a negative. After my experience I reached out to the restaurant as well as Chef Irvine by email. Neither felt my experience was worth a response. So I will give my review based on the experiences I had. Factor in this meal resulted in loss of money along with the horrible experience.  My husband and I dined at Robert Irvine's on August 1st, I had some amazing fish and chips. It was so good we returned on August 2nd so my husband could get the fish and chips. I ordered the schnitzel with a side of mushroom gravy.  After dining at Robert Irvine's Public House @ The Tropicana on August 2nd. I got food poisoning. Not just a bad 24 hours. But I was hospitalized. This experience resulted in missing the convention I was there for as well as a concert by Tim McGraw. I was so disappointed cause I was a huge fan of Irvine's and I really expected some kind of response but I guess responding to someone you put in the hospital after eating your food is not too high on their list. I'm so disappointed cause I expected much more from an Irvine restaurant. I contacted both the restaurant and Chef Irvine by email and allowed ample time for a response. I wanted to at least say they contacted me to check on me and make sure I was doing better. Unfortunately that did not happen.  And the reason I can state without a doubt that the food at Irvine's restaurant was the culprit is due to my earlier meal that day was crackers. The heat was merciless and I did not have an appetite so it was early evening when we dined at the restaurant and it was my first meal of the day.  IF I ever go back to Las Vegas, I will NEVER eat at Robert Irvine's Public House and I will NEVER recommend this restaurant to anyone else. I would not want my worst enemy to go through that awful experience. This experience caused my first trip to Vegas to be something I cannot look back on with any fond memories. I missed out on our final day of convention, the Tim McGraw concert (I cannot get any of my money back either!) And having to be pushed through an airport in a wheelchair and use barf bags all the way home. I guess you can understand why I have no fond memories. So eat there at your own risk friends.

PnbhcIo5ecSptvd0CvBcCg.text: The flank steak w/chimichurri was great but served with shoestring fries for $36 was a terrible idea. Service was ok, as I never got a refill on my soda, not even once and it felt like we were being hurried out of there.

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

joM-dniTZH4fqvJ4X913HQ.text: We walked in here without looking at any reviews.. it was time for a drink and some food so figured why not.  I had an effen cocktail.. forgot the name but it was  deliciousness in a glass.  I ordered the slaw as an appetizer since they had the cajones to put it on the menu. It was best slaw I ever had.. so good I forgot I paid $8 for it. The pizzas are medium size, perfect for 2 ppl. Did not taste like fast food pizza, very simple yet full of flavor. Service was excellent the first time.. update. Second time. Place is dead. Different bartender. Still good place

iozDcd6RRNiGFDYqjW-S3w.text: I don't normally do reviews like this, but I am just so disappointed in this resteraunt choice of operation hours.  I'm staying at the Tropicana and I've been walking by this place multiple times a day, planning for when I could find the time to go.  I went after the comedy show upstairs and arrived at around 9:45pm only to be told that the kitchen was not serving food any longer, when closing was not until 11pm!  Nowhere online does it show that there is a time that food service ends before the time of closing!  I'm just disappointed in their business choices, now I won't have a chance to try the resteraunt.

QUuo6Q6p-DXY_JGwCSH8Bw.text: Overall verdict - skip (especially given all the options around in spitting distance)   Service - meh Food - meh Ambiance - yay!  Service - attentive to a point. Didnt get any silverware until after meal was delivwred abd I asked for it. Then they were out of their draft Porter (yes at a self described gastopub) but oh well... it's vegas and stuff happens, right? Asked the server if they have other Porters and the response was... Crickets. No bueno.   Food - got the pastrami sandwich which I was told is hugely popular. Pickle was soggy. The bread had wayyyy too much butter and the bottom slice was soggy. That does NOT equal a good Pastrami sandwich. Just sayin...

jj6_3oraWX9we154t9yHow.text: The food was good at a 4 stars rating, but James the bartender makes the experience a 5 stars. Had a blast will be back.

8xAUfjA5UIVLI6_4jnYMKg.text: I wanted to like this place. First we got here early and were told we couldn't be seated early. Except we could only sit at a bar table if we had reservations. So we were seated.  Then I ordered shepherd's pie.  It had a double crust and the top one was cooked but the bottom one was raw. So they took it off the bill.  We ordered the dessert that was supposed to be lemon curd, pound cake and meringue crust. The "meringue" crust was melty and there was no lemon curd anywhere.  Instead there were strawberries and maybe some sort of raspberry stuff so really sweet and inedible.  Very disappointing.  And so loud! Hard to have a conversation.   The manager took it all off the bill but I would rather have had a great meal and paid.  8-22-19. I am updating this to reflect my recent experience.  The menu has changed, the service was excellent and the wedge salad was amazing.   I would definitely recommend it now that the bugs are worked out!

yG7xo9SPIwY8dj49gpixtQ.text: We stopped here for a few beers and a snack.  Beers were fine but the service was super slow considering how empty it was. We had the 'burnt ends' appetizer.  Do not get this dish, it's one of the worst things I've ever been served.  It was some pieces of pork belly which weren't tender, did not have good flavor, and very little of the fat was rendered.  We ate less than half and the servers did not check in with us or ask if everything was ok.

xyd39vwxJDyQjKSP-r3MPg.text: No children's menu, but the hostess pointed out that we can order 6 chicken strips for $17 and a side of fries for $6. Wow. Family friendly- not.  Lemonade $5 for each kiddo.  We liked the air hockey game.  All of the food was ok but very, very salty.  Why stack the pastrami sandwich? The bread gets very soggy when stacked; wet and mushy bread for each half.  Nachos with cheese-sauce-stuff...very gringo...can't really blame Irvine cuz authentic Mexican wouldn't be expected.   Paid over $100 but couldn't use our "free" small appetizer coupon....technically our expensive tenders, fries, sandwich with fries and steak nachos all don't count as an entree to use the coupon. Ugh.   Great waitress!  Food was just ok but too expensive for what we received. We went for convenience and just plain hunger after arriving.  We won't return...ever. :)   Mr Irvine: my suggestion, is to eat at your own restaurant and see if it even meets your own standards. Doubt that that will happen.

kLZ4FP42fo6Z-QVDMTQb0A.text: I had a comped room at the Tropicana for the evening so I thought to check out Robert Irvine's Public House. With the room, came a coupon for a free small appetizer too!  The place was nice and modern. We were greeted by the hostess and seated immediately, shortly after, someone brought us glasses of water, then our water came to take our order. The host and waiter was nice and friendly, suggested item on the menu and answered all our questions.   We ordered The F&K fondue burger, Burnt Ends pork belly, Steak & Frites, Mac & Cheese Carbonara, and the General Tso smoke chicken wings for our free appetizer.   The chicken wings came out pretty fast, however the rest of the food took a while. I would say at least 30 minutes. That would be the only thing I was disappointed about, but I didn't think it was worth taking off a whole star for that.   The food was delicious! The chicken wings was different it was general tso flavored. Th burger was also unique as it had melted cheese all over it, we thought the beef patty was a little salty. The Steak & Frites was cooked perfectly, it was delish, but the MAC & CHEESE carbonara was our favorite!!! It was so creamy and was very very delicious. I can say that I would come back there just for that. That good!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. F&amp;K Fondue Burger
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt Ends
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Frites

wP8OgVgWapm6SnAGlcTNzQ.text: Overpriced menu, underwhelming food, and shoddy service -- that sums it up pretty well. I ate dinner her twice on my recent Vegas stay and won't do it again. I'd much rather spend more money at the Tropicana's Oakville Steakhouse and at least get some return on my money. If that's too much, then just hit the Vegas strip for plenty of other reasonably priced options. While the atmosphere here looks appealing, everything else sells you short. During my two visits I tried the ribs and steak salad for entrees, then wedge salad, wings, carbonara mac, and mixed vegetables for sides/apps. While the steak salad was probably the best item I had here -- it was still a average and small for the price. For a restaurant that carries the name of notorious chef, I was specially surprised that they didn't remove the membrane from the under portion of the ribs, which helps them cook and keeps them from carrying a crispy, burnt bottom layer. The ribs felt like they were nuked, far from slow cooked w/ Plain, average BBQ sauce. I would definitely avoid this item -- even though it was recommended by our server. The wings were also very underwhelming for the +$20 price tag, which I scoffed at -- but had to talk myself into on a football Sunday. Honestly the best item from the hot items were the mixed vegetables (in picture), which even included some broccoflower. They were well seasoned and well cooked.  I will also admit the banana banoffe pie floored me and at least sent my away in peace on day 2. The key lime pie was also solid. If I had a sweet tooth, I honest would come in for either of those -- maybe a meal of veggies!! -- but nothing else listed.  I wouldn't roll the dice again on anything new, either.

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wings
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribs, Carbonara MAC, and mixed vegetables.

osprUHCqkNTDfIUhACMQcg.text: Robert Irvine's Public House is one of my go-to places on the strip. I can count on great service and a tasty meal in a comfortable setting. Not pretentious. Just good food.  Their Asian chicken and Caesar salads are delicious - perfect for a pre or post show meal. If you are really hungry, I recommend trying one of their burgers (they have some signature ones as well as a build your own option) or the ribs.  I personally love the bourbon maple salmon with bacon because it's just enough to leave room for dessert!  What's for dessert? English Banoffee Pie. BANANAS and TOFEE with whipped cream in a pie crust. How can you go wrong?   There are other things on their menu worth trying... nachos, wings, pastrami sandwich, pizzas...   Give it a shot! Be nice to your server and they will be nice to you.   Tip: locals get a discount with an ID and players card!

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian Chicken Salad
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bourbon Maple Salmon with Bacon and Brussel Sprouts
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. English Banoffee Pie

CfFsLggjh41AoiARB4-WHQ.text: I was at Irvine's Public House shortly after it opened.  Since I was at the Trop for a show, I decided to go back and do Restaurant Week.  That was a no go because they didn't start the RW menu until 5 PM.  I had tried the fish and chips on my first experience here and I opted to try it again.  It was a very curious dish.  The cod was bland as expected but a little malt vinegar helped that along some.  The chips are not British chips.  It tasted like they were covered in mustard.  It turns out the French fries are covered with a curry aioli, feta cheese, and bacon bits.  It seems like a bizarre combination but the fries were a lot better than the fish.  Payoff came with dessert.  The Banoffee pie was quite good.  Smooth and rich, it was a good way to end the meal.  Service was good.  My iced tea was refilled a couple of times and my server was always in the area for a question or to check on how I was doing.    After this meal, I have Irvine's Public House out of my system.  No need to return.

Lb6wF5TXrnhCwD1wH70xHg.text: This is the second time I come to this place and both times I left totally disappointed!  I ordered food to go and ordered the burratta with tomatoes while I waited.... the burratta was dry and it seem to be old and I had to spit some of the tomatoes because they were rotten!  I wish the would have more care with the freshness of the food.  I think I will skip it in the future!

v_z-vB47_oit8ioaEENMrg.text: How cool is it that a celebrity chef of this caliber has a restaurant inside the Tropicana! My bf and I sat at the bar to watch one of the Women's World Cup matches and we originally thought it was the Sport's Book which is located next door. What a pleasant surprise. This review is only based on the atmosphere and drinks. We planned to come back for food because everything that came out looked so good, but we never made it. The menu has a bit of everything from salads, burgers, sandwiches and pizza to Shepard's pie and fish & chips.  The cocktail, beer and wine lists are extensive. We started out with a Watermelon Mint Cooler because we were excited by the idea of fresh watermelon accompanied by Boardroom Ginger Vodka, fresh lime and mint. It was fruity and refreshing. Then we couldn't pass up their shot and a beer for $14 deal. You have 6 options and we went with the Robert Irvine: a cold glass of Stella on draft alongside a shot of chilled Patron Silver. Both went down so easily I could have continued drinking these all day.   We had fun playing their free games like giant Connect Four, shuffleboard, and some electronic arcade-type games. There are lots of large tv's and some lounge seat areas. The bartenders although attentive were NOT friendly or fun at all. Additionally, a woman next to us mentioned that the steak she had requested at medium-rare came out well done, and that she wasn't asking to send it back but only wanted to bring it to their attention. The bartender literally did not acknowledge her any of the 3 times she mentioned it but ended up giving her a discount at the end. Some friendlier staff would liven the place up.

07Apoj594vVE5yup6yiEZg.text: Hidden gem in Las Vegas.  Would have given it 5-stars but we had to wait 25-minutes after we were seated to order! (Hostess placed us in a section that was closing apparently.) anyway, that was a major glitch but the food was worth every moment of that glitch.  When we did "get" a server, he was great! (George from Hawaii)  The Ahi Tuna Sashimi was DIVINE.  In fact my friend went back the next day and had that small plate along with the shoestring fries which were ALSO AMAZING.   Seriously, the shoestring fries with the curry aioli and feta were delicious and I'm not even a fan of curry.   The Asian Salad was good but it couldn't be compared to the phenomenal sashimi or shoestring fries.   The ribs were good a little too peppery for my taste but the coleslaw helped cool the palate.   Really there was absolutely no room for dessert but we had to indulge and try the skillet cookie. OMG. Incredible.  The ice cream was the perfect addition to the skillet l; cutting the sweetness of the cookie, making it perfect. And it was HUGE, shareable.   So glad we stopped at Robert Irvine's PH even if it was our last night in Las Vegas. It will be one of our regular stops when we come to town.   You should totally have a meal here!  Updated to 5-star. Manager wrote and addressed the extended wait time. Top notch restaurant. Many don't follow-up! And my friend dined there the next day and re-ordered some of the favorite plates!

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. RI BABY BACK RIBS HALF (1/2 of the half)
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SKILLET BAKED TRIPLE CHOCOLATE COOKIE
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kitchen

QKamdtqARKZHX25lMjzryA.text: I'm a big fan of Chef Irvine and I have dined here twice. The first visit was good, the second was a disaster. Perhaps a third time will be the real litmus test, but after my most recent visit, I have no intention nor desire to return anytime soon.   The pub atmosphere is really cool, wide open with lots of t.v.s (a great place to pre-game before a VGK hockey game) and a large, central, wraparound bar. It's a fun hangout spot and would be even moreso if the prices weren't so expensive!  You'll find typical sounding pub food here, like cheese fries, wings, and burgers. I say "typical sounding" because each one has Irvine's wild chef spin on it. There's nothing boring on the menu here, and every dish is creative and out there -- sometimes to a fault.   Since this restaurant is located on the Strip, it's one that is aimed at tourists. That means high prices. As a Vegas local, I'd love to hang out here and have drinks and bar snacks, but the prices are ridiculous. (Maybe offering a discount or something for locals who would gladly become regulars would be helpful; just a thought).   An extensive craft beer menu will please all beer drinkers.   I've eaten most of the small plates here as well as a burger, and they ranged from decent to gross. The burgers are good, but mine ($22) was served cold and with a stale bun. The menu touted homemade cheese sauce which sounded awesome, until my burger arrived and it was POURED OVER THE TOP OF THE BUN. Gross! I couldn't even eat the thing without a knife and fork.   The chicken wings ($24 / dozen; yeah, you read that correctly) are nasty, not crispy at all, and not even spicy. When I can eat 'em and not even break a sweat, that means the sauce is weak.   The things the kitchen does well are all the dishes with fried potatoes -- tater tots, french fries, all are good. But it's hard not to love fries! The tater tot poutine is my favorite, but it's hard to get over the fact that you're paying $16 for a handful of tots.The menu has changed a bit over the months, so don't get too set on a favorite dish.   I don't hate this place and I want to love it, but it's really difficult to with the mediocrity both in terms of service, the kitchen, and the prices. Expect to drop a minimum of $80 - $100 for two to eat dinner (not even counting drinks)!  I don't mind paying for truly gourmet chef-inspired food, but this place is a huge letdown.

84vvNoDO_Qc4R7MdBX9SFg.text: I've been waiting to come here since they opened and just have never seemed to find the time. I thought restaurant week 2019 to be the perfect opportunity to sample their delicacies. First off the poutine. Man I could have stopped their and been full. But since it's my American right to be a glutton I moved onto the fish and chips and finished her up with the banoffee. Service was spot on and interactive. I look forward to my next visit.

Ti1L0pXIEXbSA9zqonFuPQ.text: Back again a year later, this time ordering completely different things. My chicken Milanese sandwich was crispy and flavorful on ciabatta bread. It was served with a tasty-sounding lemon caper aioli that was a plain mayo. It was better without it.   I got the tater tots (a favorite last time I visited), which are so dang good I could happily get a big bowl of them and nothing else. I don't understand the blue cheese and bacon with it: they're perfect the way they are.  My wife's blackened mahi mahi sandwich was tasty but a bit on the dry side. The achiote aioli was terrific (on her sandwich and mine).   The chicken with my daughter's Caesar salad was juicy and flavorful, and the dressing had just the right touch of anchovy. My son's pizza was one of the better thin crust pizzas I've ever had, with a drizzle of pesto.  I got a beer, my wife got a wine, and it was $158 with a tip for our meal. The service was a bit slow, considering how deserted it was. No complaints about the food, but, wowie wow do you pay for all this!

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Milanese sandwich with bacon tater tots, blue cheese dressing, and blue cheese crumbles. Amazing.

Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A massive burger with an egg on a buttermilk biscuit. Totally impractical - the bottom of the &#34;bun&#34; disintegrated immediately - but tasty.
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super crispy tater tots. Tater tots!!!

daAvczIJ5w2y-vVYpsITNA.text: I surveyed the menu and reviews before my visit and asked friends for recommendations. Don't get your heart set on anything because apparently they change it up frequently. Friends suggested several dishes and not a single one was still available- no french onion fondue, lamb shank, deviled eggs, heirloom tomato and ciabatta salad, etc but they do have a ton of generic sandwiches and pizzas. Go figure. In any case, I took it as a warning and prepared for a dismal dining experience only to enjoy the majority of our dishes!  CHILLED JUMBO SHRIMP SCAMPI TOASTS: Pretty presentation, fresh poached shrimp, interesting combination of flavors and textures with avocado and ricotta, wish there was more lemon sauce. PH SMOKED CHICKEN WINGS: $14/6 piece is a bit steep and these were on the smaller side of average, sauce was decent (mild to me, hot to my friend), served over bread with celery, carrot, and ranch. BURRATA & NEVADA STONE FRUIT: I assume the fruit was white peaches, but this salad was actually a pretty amazing flavor combo with peppery arugula, creamy burrata, and sweet fruit topped with almonds and pepper. PRESSED PROSCIUTTO PIADINI: Mozz and prosciutto is already a match made in heaven, but add pesto and wrap it in soft naan? I'm sold. This was not as good as expected, half-cut presentation is pretty but ingredients slide around and fall out. "Pesto" was a basil cream sauce, would have been better with straight pesto. This is served with a mountain of fries, which were unseasoned and on the hard side. STEAK FRITES: Perfect med-rare cook on the steak, topped with a tasty chimmi churri sauce I could have used more of, and served with a generous portion of unseasoned asparagus and more unseasoned, hard fries. The vast majority of our fries went uneaten, but everything else was decent. How does a gastropub do fries so poorly? Whatever, the steak was delish. CARBONARA "MAC&CHEESE": Cavatappi pasta served in a cream sauce with peas and bacon. Generous portion, went unfinished not because it wasn't good but because it's so heavy. ENGLISH BANNOFFEE PIE: Chef's specialty, per those who watch his shows. I enjoyed the flavor combo of banana and toffee more than I thought I might, and the espresso ice cream paired well with it. Presentation was nice but chocolate drizzle would be better on top- white plate with a white triangle pie slice is visually boring but the flavors were so good we actually finished the dessert after this massive meal!  Service from Contessa was casual and courteous. Location ambiance is weird, for a build-out it feels like a generic casino cafe with odd western decor accents like leather-wrapped plumbing pipes? The entrance is dramatic and the bar is beautiful, and like that they have a functional shuffleboard table to play while you wait for a table.

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bannoffee with espresso ice cream
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert drinks
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert menu

nPg3uAVlTjZx_LkuigducA.text: We had 2 meals here while staying at the Tropicana: fish and chips and a roasted salmon dish. The fish and chips sat upon not just fries, but more of a poutine. We felt the fish was cooked excellently, the batter was crispy but not too thick, the fish tender and juicy.   The second meal, which I remembered to take pictures of, included their poutine appetizer, which we got for free as we used the coupon included with our room key cards. Tater tot poutine. Very good. Goat cheese really made the dish. The salmon was almost perfect--a tad overcooked. The filet sat atop roasted new potatoes and Brussels sprouts. The sprouts need to be blanched prior to roasting as they were quite hard.   Overall everything is well-cooked and tasty. I dropped a star because the dishes are a bit overpriced and the place is noisy, to the point you almost have to yell at each other.

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tater tot poutine
Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon

BpYiUshcZN56MKcA9bcVdw.text: Was really expecting more. Wife ordered Nachos whic had very large pieces of raw onion that kind of ruined that dish.   I ordered the fish and chips, the fish was soggy. I was not a fan of bed of fries chips smothered in ph sauce.   The ambiance is great, the staff was curteous and friendly, but the food is in my opinion over priced.

JhS1yY_ojQByXGd2fM83fA.text: I really, really wanted to like this place. As with others, I'm a huge fan of Chef Irvine and was excited to give this place a whirl. Sat at the bar and was promptly greeted. Ordered an old fashion and it was ok, not great, but drinkable. Having had a late lunch, I decided on a small plate. Love poutine, and they have a twist on the classic with pulled pork, tater tots and goat cheese. The dish was luke warm, soggy tots and bland pork and gravy made for a huge dissapointment.   This experience makes this a "Restaurant Impossible" for an encore. Chef, you might think about shooting an episode on your own turf! It needs it.

IueYXub6LVsNVQgKuvevfA.text: I'm a big fan of Robert and Restaurant Impossible so I was excited to finally try his restaurant. My husband and I had a great experience! The food was really delicious and our waiter, Fred was excellent. Since we were staying at The Tropicana, we received a coupon for a free appetizer. We started off with Ahi Tuna which was kind of like a poke bowl on light toast. For our entrees, my husband had the ribs and I had the salmon. The salmon was out of this world-not fishy at all and full of flavor. My husband really enjoyed the ribs and let me eat some of the Mac and cheese that came on the side which we really enjoyed as well. Overall, a great experience and I would like to come back and try something new again!

photos.caption: Photo of Robert Irvine's Public House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bourbon maple salmon.

eEkYpOyvhc0a9TsWMuRh0Q.text: Initially I was really excited to try this restaurant.  I always respected Robert Irvine as a television presenter and his advice to better restaurants.  I found myself stuck at the Tropicana for a business event and didn't want to travel anywhere else with traffic and my unwillingness to support MGM properties after they sued victims of a dreadful mass shooting.   My personal experience in Irvine'sTropicana Las Vegas restaurant was disappointing and sad.   The service I experienced was beyond terrible.  I was basically forgotten.  When I asked for the check the waiter asked if I wanted a refill, yeah maybe 15 minutes ago, a little late now pal (they did try to make good offering a take away).  I ordered the steak frites and was shocked to find the plate broken into three portions for presentation. Generous portions of fries and an abundance of asparagus but this tiny tiny little piece of meat for steak.   Nothing tasted good because it was dominated by this oil or dressing that the asparagus sits in.  So fries were soggy and asparagus was drenched. I wonder if you request them to plate them separately if they'd oblige?  The atmosphere was pleasant and it was dominated by a host for a rodeo watch party which made for interesting people watching.   Steak, soda and tip ran about $60.  Not ideal by any means.  Especially with the lack of service provided.  Saddened from the experience, I will not return.
